Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Resort in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Barb D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Wyndham Grand Desert in March. We had a wonderful time. We had a fully equiped clean roomy 1 bedroom unit.(The larger side of a lock-off) Our room faced the pool area and was very quiet. We spent much of our time touring the area and the city. You do not need to have a car to enjoy the city. You could walk the short distance to "The Strip" but Wyndham provides a shuttle bus that runs continually until 10 p.m.They have arrangemnets with another shuttle if youu should choose to stay later. You can purchase an all day bus ticket by the bus stops for $7 and ride for 24 hours. We rented a car for 2 days. The rental company came to the resort to pick us up. After a tiring day, we enjoyed coming back to soak in the hot tub and go for a swim.

Reviews.Title: “Nice respite from "The Strip"”
Reviews.Author: w0rks2travel
Reviews.Content: Prior to my most recent trip I didn't recommend taking kids to Vegas, but my stay at Wyndham Grand Desert (without kids) changed my mind. As has been stated in previous reviews, this is a timeshare property and while you do not have daily housekeeping (personally, I don't mind not being awakened each morning by the sound of housekeeping knocks and carts creaking down the hall -- especially if staying just a few days), but there are washer/dryer in each unit and I loved being able to have clean clothes to unpack when I returned home. Speaking of the washer and dryer, they are LOUD, as are the dishwasher and the heating/cooling unit. The issue of sound proofing would be my only negative comments, which would also include one's neighbors, especially if you are in a unit that has a connecting apartment. We (party of 2) were in the smallest unit (1 bedroom suite) and it was perfectly suited for us. Although the cooking area is noted as a "kitchenette", it does have all the conveniences of the larger units: stove/oven, microwave, blender, etc., just in a smaller space. Also, if you have an early flight, plan on a lengthy wait to check into your unit (unless it's during low occupancy). We arrived at 11am, and were not able to check in until 2 pm, which was still 2 hours before official, so we weren't complaining. We knew ahead of time and brought something to keep us occupied. They also stored our luggage, so not a big hassle. Although there are a few bellmen, don't expect the prompt service you'd get at a conventional hotel; there are three separate "towers", and if not in the main one (tower II), it can be a bit of a hassle getting your baggage to your unit. The property is located a few blocks from The Strip, and though there were some that walked the distance (approximately 15 - 20 minutes), Wyndham offers a complimentary shuttle until 10pm that takes you to Harrah's (neighbors to Imperial Palace, Flamingo, Venetian, the Wynn) and back. The Rio shuttle is also available for transportation back to Wyndham until midnight, but there are specific details you'll need to get from the front desk. This service allows for enjoying the hustle and bustle of the casinos, shopping, shows, people watching, etc. that exists on the main drag, and then returning to the tranquility of a virtually smoke-free (inside areas), family friendly environment. Which brings me to why I'd recommend this location, whether travelling with children or not. The activities center contains a video game area with multiple stations including a Wii setup, foosball, pingpong, pool table and multiple board games and DVDs for complimentary check out to your unit. Across the hall is also a computer room (ages 16 & up) with complimentary internet and printing services. Outdoor recreation includes three pools (one adults only) & hot tubs that are well proportioned and situated for single or family relaxation. Although the resort was at full capacity (spring break), neither the pools nor the indoor areas were overly crowded, and elevator wait times were reasonable. Others have noted the lack of suitable restaurant facilities, which is true. I didn't try anything from the cafe, so I can't comment on what they do offer; there is also a Starbucks cart in the mornings, and a bar off the lobby. We prepared breakfasts and snacks in our unit (shuttle bus - $4- to the grocery store a few times a week; show your Wyndham key for the advertised specials), and ate in a couple restaurants (excellent surf & turf at Embers in the Imperial Palace) on the strip. After getting the bill at the end of each meal, we welcomed the option of cooking, especially if we had traveled with kids. One thing I think the Wyndham should consider to make the most of their location and appeal to families is to offer a childcare service - in particular at night when parents might want to take in a late show or night entertainment. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay because we had the best of both worlds -- as much action & entertainment as we wanted close by, and the comforts/convenience of home at Grand Desert.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Saabi13
Reviews.Content: My husband along with our 9 month old daughter and another couple stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in Tower 3 of the Wyndham Grand Desert. Our view was very nice, facing Planet Hollywood and Paris on the Strip. The room was very clean, nicely decorated and quite comfortable. We did have an issue with the fuse constantly burning out in the Master Bedroom but the staff was very quick to respond. This resort is about a 7-8 minute walk from the strip but they offer shuttle services to Harrahs which was very convenient. Only one complaint I would have is the on premise deli/coffee shop could stand to stay open longer. There's one particular incident which occurred at the resort and the way it was handled is what makes me want to recommend this resort as a must stay for everyone.... We had just come to the lobby to take the shuttle and as we were heading towards the shuttle to board, the driver drove away. We called out after it, and luckily for us the security guard, a limo driver and the Manager of the resort itself happened to be there to witness what had just happened. They too tried chasing down the shuttle but to no avail. Needless to say they were very upset, especially the Manager considering we had a baby with us....right away the limo driver and manager offered the limo service to us for the remainder of our trip and we actually did not end up using the shuttle after that! The service at this resort is something I have never experienced. I have stayed at other places where the service has been good and staff friendly but NOTHING compares to our experience at the Wyndham Grand Desert. Everyone from the front desk to the maintenance crews were nothing but pleasant and made a nice resort into a one of a kind resort which I will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: MrMcAlister
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this resort! We have always enjoyed our stay for a number of reasons. Because this is a shared resort, it seems the hotel staff are more attentive to the needs of the guests, and are very pleasant throughout. It is also a GREAT place for kids as they have fun classes (making soap, for example) and a game room with Pool, video games and ping pong. In addition, the variety of pools (one for families, one for adults) makes laying out a peaceful or joyful occasion. The location is great as well, as the Hard Rock Casino and Hotel are located on the same block, as well as some of the more local gambling joints such as the Ellis Island Casino and Terribles Casino. The strip is only two blocks away as well. The rooms are also great. Very spacious and we have yet to have an issue with noise. We have been here several times as guests and will continue to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great units and location”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Desert seven times. The rooms are always very clean with nice bathrooms and kitchens. The pool area is beautiful - ask for a room with a view of the pools. Lots of parking, and it is an easy walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat from the strip noise, smoke and chaos!”
Reviews.Author: patriotic
Reviews.Content: We are in the middle of our stay and it's been fantastic. The rooms are spacious, clean, updated and best of all, quiet. No gaming and no smoking; divine. The hotel is 2 very long blocks east of the strip. It's a long walk. I like this aspect because the strip is a crowded, loud and smoke-filled. There is a shuttle bus to the strip. Contrary to previous posts, we do not hear our neighbors at all. No noises, toilets flushing, showers, etc. The AC unit is a bit loud but this doesn't bother us at all. The suites have a full kitchen, inning and living rooms, 2 bedrooms/baths, jacuzzi tubs, showers, nice flat-screens, lots of channels and amenities. The pools are very nice, warm and equipped with lifeguards. There are hot tubs and a gym. The lobby staff were very helpful and although, the timeshare sales speech came up, they haven't been too pushy. I can't find anything to complain about. The only thing that could be improved is the lack of a true on-site restaurant. There is a deli but more options would be great. It's a great family resort. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice condo style property - only a complimentary shuttle ride away from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: sophiegirl04
Reviews.Content: Very nice property that can very nicely meet your needs - or so completely not. if you want ...spotlessly clean condo style 1, 2, 3 bedroom unit with complete kitchen, nice living room area with comfortable seating, and bedrooms with higher quality linens ...a more family oriented property off the Strip - but not miles out of town ...overall nice amenities - pool, game room, bar, small market & deli ...friendly front desk, bellman, etc ...a property withOUT an on site casino ...a free shuttle TO the strip (Harrahs) running every 20 minutes or so from 9am to 10pm You will like this place. Rates seemed fairly reasonable for what you received, but we looked more last minute so perhaps could have done better if we booked earlier. if you want on the Strip, lively crowd, casino action - look elsewhere. We were in a 3BR unit on the end of Tower 3. If you are floor 10 and above you have a nice view of the Strip. The shuttle ran on time, and was convenient. Building 3 is 1st to be picked up, and first dropped off, also nice. (not that it is any mega-bus, I am just impatient) We were guests of friends who are owners. It is a lovely place, and if it fits your needs I highly recommend it. We don't come to Vegas often, nor do we stay very long - so I prefer a more Strip centered property, where I can pop out and grab a Starbucks in the AM, an ice cream in the PM, and more easily get a break from the crowds mid day. I don't use the pool or other family facilities (and sure don't come here to cook!) so the very nicest aspects of this property are wasted on me. If I was coming here with a family, or perhaps older parents - it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!! Sooo spacious!!”
Reviews.Author: ayoun
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal booking through sun and snow(?) on vrbo.com. Laura was very quick to respond and helpful. The front desk staff was very friendly and they took no for an answer when asked about attending a timeshare presentation. We arrived at 11am, we couldnt Get into our room until 4, but we used te pool and even the shuttle while waitinh. The Shuttle was really helpful and the drivers were friendly. It's a bit off the strip, we walked it several times and it prob took about 10minutes or so. It can seem long after walking the strip all day but it's really not too bad. The room itself was great! Huge! 3 bedroom, 2 baths. Extremely clean and well stocked. We've stayed at a lot of condos and I have to say this was the best stocked of all the ones we've ever stayed at. Although the washer/dryer unit was quite small and noisy-minor things. We were in tower 3 which is the closest to the strip. There was a small pool at the bottom and two larger ones in the main building. All very nice. We didn't participate any of the activities but if we had been there longer we may have. We did take advantage of the activities center will the kids though. They thought it was great, not crowded but had a good selection of activities. Minor noise from the airport but again not a big problem. We'd stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great place!”
Reviews.Author: Lascinco
Reviews.Content: During my last Vegas vacations, I stayed with my friends at the Wyndham Grand Desert. We fell in love with this great resort. The opportunity to have breakfast in our appartment, having drinks and snacks in the refrigerator whenever we felt like it was great. Our two bedroom appartment was spacious, well equiped and very comfortable. The whole place was very clean and beautiful. The pools and jaccuzis are great. The staff is very helpful and friendly...I'll go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Family Resort off of the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: somnova14
Reviews.Content: If you are a family looking to vacation in Las Vegas I highly recommend this resort. The resort is slightly off the strip so if you do not want to expose your kids to the "not so kid friendly activities" in Vegas you don't have to. The pool area outside the main tower is gorgeous. It featured an adult pool, kids pool, two large hot tubs and plenty of lounge chairs for relaxing around the pool. Our suite resembled a small apartment. Had a full kitchen, dining room, living room, master bedroom with master bath, second bedroom (two queen beds), bathroom and washer dryer unit. A tip....book your shows and dinner through the resort. There is a tour desk there that is specifically designated for this and can save you more money than booking at the casino or general box office. Additionally if you book a dinner and show through them they provide limo service. This is a time share resort. We stayed as a guest of someone who is a time share owner so I am not sure of those logistics, but if you are interested in Wyndham times shares they do offer daily tours. It is a very beautiful, quiet and secure place to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Our Presidential Suite had more bathrooms then my house!”
Reviews.Author: Absolutesaint8
Reviews.Content: This past August was my third stay in the Presidental Suite at the WGD and I absolutely love staying there. The room is unreal, boasting three bedrooms and three full baths, and it was more then up to date with electronics and technology. Also, there was an amazing hot tub in the master bedroom that had a peek through to the rest of the bedroom. The grounds were kept up beautifully and there was a convienent shuttle service offered to guests. I only had one complaint and that was the staff calling almost daily to push selling timeshares after I informed them I was not interested in owning another timeshare property. Other than that- no complaints in Sin City!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem just blocks from the strip”
Reviews.Author: ne65vette
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this resort. Everything was clean, newer looking and very comfortable bed. You are a 5-10 minute shuttle ride from the strip. Close to the strip without all the loud crzainess to deal with. No high pressure sales from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: roger3403
Reviews.Content: I booked a 1 BR unit via Ebay for 4329. I was very pleased with the unit, which cosisted of BR, Kitchen, Living room, dining area, bath with whirlpool as well as shower. My partner particularly appreciated the 2 areas with sinks, she was able to have all her things at her own area. Located 3-4 blocks off the central strip, convienient to walk, or to use the shuttle bus which drops off at Harrah's. Comfortable, clean, helpful staff, be sure to ask at concierage about specials they have for dining, sightseeing and shows. I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: wander2
Reviews.Content: It is spring break so there are many families. We are staying in a 2 bedroom for a family trip in March 2012. Unit is spacious. We went to the area Costco to get items for breakfast and snacks. Kitchen has what we need to fix a few quick meals so don't have to eat out all the time. The location is why we chose this resort. It is about 10-15 minute walk to the strip. The area is safe and there are guests who walk to the strip. The resort offers a shuttle to Harrah's so it is another option if you don't want to drive on the strip. Wifi is free in the rooms. Activity center has free games and DVDs that guests can check out. One of the three pools at the resort are for adults only. The main pools close around 10 PM. The one at tower III opens 24/7 but it is smaller than the main pools. Parking in level 1 for guests who stay in towers I and II is very convenient since you can go directly from indoor parking to your room without going through the lobby. Tower III guests would park outdoors. There are activities for the week. The staff at the resort are friendly and helpful. Definitely family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Wyndham”
Reviews.Author: Lauran24
Reviews.Content: We did 5 rooms at this timeshare for my stepdaughters recent wedding at the Wynn. They were all two bedrooms in the third building which is definitely quieter with less kids. The building is also the closest to the strip, only a half mile off, very, very easy walk, especially with drink in hand. We usually stay at the carriage house which I absolutely love, but we needed more rooms this trip. The only drawback is you have to go to the main building to sign up for bellhop service so you can bring all your bags in a cart up the elevator. That seemed like a pita so we just did it ourselves. The rooms are spacious, comfy and the beds were great. The kitchen appliances were great, complete with pans, pots, measuring cups, bowls, microwave, toaster and coffee maker. When we checked in, we were greeted with wine, and after we were done checking everyone in, they gave us more! It is so nice to cook breakfast, dinner and late night snacks! The gym was a nice feature, however this was a party trip, so the only eexercise I got was walking the strip. Which we did a lot of, it's so easy to walk, it's great people watching, and I dont like to be too lazy! Pool was really nice, and they crack down on the smokers, which is great as well. There are some really nice and plenty of organized trips and tours, so if you were a Vegas virgin, or just didn't know what to do, you could easily do some of these. There were a lot more than I've seen in other timeshares. They also have a free shuttle to harrahs. Concierge was great! We needed to get a limo at the last minute to the wedding and they found us a 20 person one in a half hour for cheap! So if you need assistance, definitely call on them, I was very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: marthamommy
Reviews.Content: We have visited this property before, but it's been a few years back and this was our first time in the 2 bedroom unit. We had 4 adults and 2 children staying in the unit for one week. It had plenty of space for all of us. The kitchen had all the things we needed for preparing & cooking our meals. We have stayed in many other time-shares around the county, but this is the first one that had decent sized coffee cups and very large bowls. The dishwash is loud, so it's best start it after breakfast if you are leaving for the day. It's also best to do smaller loads of laundry as the dryer does better with small to med loads. There is a Vons and Albertson's grocery store nearby, but both are very small. For the best selection, go to the Walmart that just a little further out.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break OFF the Strip”
Reviews.Author: GetmeouttaMN
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal for a week at Wyndham Grand Desert during spring break. We rented a two-bedroom deluxe. It was perfect! The only thing lacking was a towel bar close to the jacuzzi and shower in the master bath - easily remedied with a hangar. A little far to walk to the strip, but we drove and parked at any number of casinos offering free self park. Nice retreat after the party atmosphere of the Strip and Fremont Street. Now if only they could have made Vegas warmer than MN!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Eddie0101
Reviews.Content: Wyndham was great. All the units are self contained which is great for saving money that you would rather spend on fun things. The staff are very helpful and the pool area looks very nice although we were there in winter so didn't do any swimming. The rooms are modern and homely and very clean and have washing machines and dryers if needed. They also have a free shuttle which drops you off in the middle of the strip (at Harrah's) and also run an activities bus which takes you to the supermarket for a small fee. We found walking to Planet Hollywood or MGM only took 10 minutes if you don't mind some minimal exercise. Wyndham is aimed at families and older couples so is nice and quiet at night but very convenient to all the fun of the strip

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tina G
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in tower 1, 5th floor 2br unit it was very nice, they have a shuttle that picks you up at each tower,you also can walk but it is a long walk but vegas is about walking,they have a store,a deli cafe,the pools were nice they are heated but the only one that stays open 24 hours is in the tower 3. The activities well we only went to one of them and we felt rushed the other one we were going to the crock pot the melted the wax was not working. Everyone was nice, everything in the room was great washer,dryer,the only thing i didn't care for was the bathroom sink in master room didn't drain very good a maint,man did come and try to fix it but still drain very slow but thats small stuff,if you have a room at the end then you have a long hall way to walk. They do call you after you are checked in to make sure everything is good and working. The internet is free.

Reviews.Title: “QUIET ESCAPE FROM THE HUSTLE AND BUSTLE”
Reviews.Author: philcanko
Reviews.Content: Best things about resort: The staffs were polite, curtious and friendly. The grounds and facilities were kept clean and orderly. I was asked to attend the presentation but could not make it due to our busy activities and nobody really bothered us to reschedule. The resort is a walking distance from the strip and far away enough that if and when you are tired of the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas strip, it is nice to know that you could unwind in your nice quiet resort. Unlike when you stay in a hotel, you always have to put up with the crowd. Best attractions or restaurants nearby: I found the food in the strips and hotel pricey. I guess you can't expect nothing else from a tourist spot. The seafood buffet at the RIO is pretty good, for $40.00 per head and a lot of selection, you cannot go wrong. The buffet at MGM Grand is pretty good as well. Here is the thing that I found out about the buffet at MGM, you can pay once and you can come back again for the rest of the day. Something I guess they do not advertice loudly. Overall Review: At the beginning after trading to Wyndam Grand Desert, I thought I might have made a mistake. The person I spoke to over the phone to confirm my stay and posted my question wasn't very friendly. But after finally making it there, I was surprisingly amaze on how curtious and friendly the staffs were at the facilities and front desks. Although I still would have preferred to have gotten a 2 bedroom units, the units I had did sufficed. I did not get a chance to visit the other 2 towers because of our scheduled but we did managed to enjoy the building we were at (tower #3). The amenities weren't as big as it should bel but then again, there isn't as many people using them. Again, the resort is quiet, pieceful and attractive. I definitely would recommend this resort to anybody visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Who says the Casinos are the only attractions in Vegas?”
Reviews.Author: deputy_tom
Reviews.Content: We had a few months left to decide on whether to book a hotel or go for a vacation rental after we registered in a Golf Conference and Show that was held at the Las Vegas Convention Center. After doing my usual internet research, I came across the Wyndham Grand Dessert due to it's proximity to the Convention Center and The Strip. After a few email exchanges with the Rental Consultant ( who I can recommend privately), we decided to book a 2 Bedroom Deluxe unit. It was a long haul trip for us and we were all looking forward to a cozy place to acclimatize before we get down to business. And I can say is that the 12 hour flight was all worth it when we arrived at Wyndham Grand Dessert. From the appearance of the building, the ease at registration and most of all the room itself. We were amazed at how it made us feel so much at home and more! And to think that I was a bit apprehensive when we were told that our unit is at Tower 3. Every question regarding the place that I had earlier were answered upon seeing the place up close. The unit had everything that made our 7 day stay very comfortable. I'd say the only thing missing was the guard dog. But I think the facility's security was able to handle that when the younger guests across our unit were making a ruckus probably from a late night trip down the Strip. The proximity of the place was also a big plus. Less than 10 minutes away from the Convention Center, the Strip and the airport. Parking was free and ample. Free wi-fi kept us in touch with work and family. Although I must admit the connection was a lot faster in the ground floor Business Center of the building. I don't gamble and I don't drink. But our stay here will definitely make me want to come back to Las Vegas when the opportunity arises. Oh did I mention the "we" during this stay was my boss and his wife? They of course got the spacious master's bedroom *wink* Keep it up Wyndham Grand Dessert!

Reviews.Title: “Longtime timeshare owner - maybe I have more perspective?”
Reviews.Author: Monica O
Reviews.Content: We were a bit disappointed with the 2 bedroom presidential unit. Perhaps it was because it was in the oldest tower so maybe the 2 newer towers have nicer presidential units? We even asked at the front desk to verify we were in a "presidential" unit. Perhaps compared to a stay in a 2 bedroom in Sedona or to a recent stay in a 2 bedroom in a Marriott at Hilton Head, it just didn't come close. We were kind of bummed. The ac wasn't working well in the master bedroom so was always 3-4 degrees warmer than in the spare bedroom. Some might like this - but we like it very cool in order to sleep. They had a "governor" on the thermostat so we had it as low as could get it - which was fine in the spare bedroom! The furiture in the presidential unit was purchased for "looks" - not for comfort. Dining room table was a true "knee-banger" from every seat!! Wish I'd taken pictures - no thought put into people actually sitting at it with the decorative iron all around the base so you couldn't slide chair in to sit. Little things indicated no attention to detail - basket for silverware was missing from dishwasher - not a big deal to us but could be to a family. Very decorative frame on mirror in bathroom which must have been hard to clean cracks and crevices - looked dirty. Can't imagine the bacteria there since right in front of the sink where people wash, brush teeth, etc. Common sense would say - make sure install things that can be cleaned! Lobby and pools, sitting areas, etc., truly are beautiful and staff around them was helpful and friendly. Must be because it is in Vegas but my biggest complaint was that the lobby was way overscented!! So many people are sensitized to these fragrances but Wyndham definitely wasn't afraid to use the fragrances there! We stayed 4 nights in the 2 bedroom then moved, per our reservation, to 1 bedroom deluxe for 2 nights. The downgrade had more comfortable furniture - not fancy trimmings ... but we liked it. Biggest problem was HUGE amount of fragrance in hall and in unit in the 1 bedroom. condos and hotels really need to figure this out - I ended up pretty sick from it. Great concierge who was very helpful with anything we asked him. We did pitty the poor people who actually wanted to use the fitness room in the mornings!!! You had to run a gauntlet of people to get there because everyone had to go through the hall where salespeople were trying to sell timeshares to new customers. Those salespeople clearly didn't give a darn about customers already staying there and trying to get access to the fitness room. They made no attempt to keep hall clear or even to stay to one side or to even just step out of the way when we'd go down hall. They were on a mission to sell and you trying to go through them to get to use the facilities was not on their agenda. We bought one meal bought from cafe onsite - Tuscan Chicken Sandwich and a tuna melt - pretty bad!!

Reviews.Title: “A great first stay in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Patiently56
Reviews.Content: Through a friend who owns, my group was able to stay at the Wyndham Grand Desert in Las Vegas. It was awesome. The room (2 bedroom Presidential) was immaculate, the beds were comfortable, and we had no problems other than a non-working icemaker (They offered to send up ice from room service). I wish that we had taken advantage of the pool areas more, but we were out and about on the strip most of the time. The staff was friendly and helpful when we called and asked questions, and resolved the ice issue quickly. The free shuttle was great -- my only wish is that it ran a little longer. I would definitely stay here in the future. An excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not so nice.”
Reviews.Author: HuaracheRotos
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Grand Desert Resort is a fairly nice hotel. Clean and well kept hotel. We came on Spring Break to Las Vegas through an El Cid Exchange with RCI. My parents had never come so it was an opportunity for them to see the sights and lights of Las Vegas. Yes, the hotel's proximity to the strip is close and the shuttle from the hotel is a awesome feature but let me tell you of the additional aspects that the hotel nor other sites tell you. 1. The hotel does not provide daily maid service. It will clean your room at a cost of $70 for surface cleaning or $100 for a more detail clean. 2. The shuttle which begin at 9:30 a.m. has a last shuttle at 10:00 p.m. and only leaves you at the Harrah's casino. 3. Want to go to the grocery store to stock the room fridge, it will cost you $4.00. 4. The staff is friendly as they are checking you in or greeting you on the property but call enough times to get clean towels, additional soap or toliet paper and their tone changes. It is so unfortunate that as El Cid Vacation Club owners we were not given the same type of service that we are accustom to at an El Cid Resort. The Wyndham Grand Desert is a nice hotel and for the price had all the amenities we need however, after paying monthly maintance fees we expected not to have to ask for more toliet paper.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: itsloulou2u
Reviews.Content: We bid and won an auction on skyauction, wonderful location, very upscale room. Had washer/dryer, dishwasher, stove, fridge, microwave. Great deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Rockvalley
Reviews.Content: Clean and quiet. Nice pool areas; sheltered from the wind by the buildings, but that also creates shade in early morning and late afternoon. That might be nice in the hot summer, but in March we would have enjoyed more sun. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Shuttle to Harrahs is nice, but it is an easy walk to Planet Hollywood area during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough, but Very Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: robbierob16
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to stay in Vegas near the strip but family friendly (no casino inside) this is a good choice. It's a time share that is rented out on a daily, weekly basis. I was here for a family wedding and it was a comfortable home base for the weekend. Rooms are large and beds are comfy. Negatives include: dreadfully thin walls. (I could hear our neighbors taking the silverware from the drawer and every conversation as if they were in my room.) Also, the only dining option is a 'snack bar' that leaves one seeking alternatives off premises. Staff is nice and helpful. 2 pools, 1 for families and 1 for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Very special property!”
Reviews.Author: Vermont95
Reviews.Content: Lovely resort with excellent, professional and helpful staff. Shuttle to Harrah's on the strip a plus for those without a car. Stayed in Tower 2 (lobby, computer bank) 14th floor with a city view. Super clean room with 1 bedroom, living room with kitchenette and small dining table, very useful especially for breakfast. Grocery shopping shuttle available for those who want to stock up on necessities for the week. Enjoyed walking by the pools and landscaped courtyard during day and night, very pretty. Thought it might be hard to be off strip, but found the shuttle to be perfectly fine and only used a cab for early morning ride to a convention on strip. The property is beautiful and I heard many people comment that that have stayed multiple times here - I plan to be back too!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend with friends”
Reviews.Author: Gail458
Reviews.Content: The resort property is beautiful and very well maintained. The free shuttle to and from Harrahs was a pleasant surprise and well used. We have stayed at the big name Vegas hotels in the past and staying at the Wyndam was so much more relaxing. We felt like we were "coming home" each night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Travis W
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful resort, the property was very clean and well maintained. Staff was very friendly. Shuttle to Harrah's was convenient and reliable. Had no issues walking to the strip from the hotel either.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lovingjj
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here Had the deluxe one bedroom suite very very nice Even with this being part of my timeshare we where not pressured to buy ...Also found out about the underground parking and we could just take the elevator up to our suite from the garage and did not have to go though the lobby....Would certainly stay here again... Moncton Nb..Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great resort.”
Reviews.Author: Fun4AnT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with two other couples. Shuttle service to/from Harrah's on The Strip is great. It's also not a bad walk. We actually walked to The Strip more than we used the shuttle, even after dark. Shoot, there were nights we were walking to the resort around midnight to go to bed and we were passing couples headed to the hotels/casinos just getting their night started! The resort itself was very nice as were the staff we interacted with during our stay. The pools are beautiful. They are located between the buildings, so the sun didn't shine on them alot, but they were still great. Our 2-bedroom room was well appointed, clean and very nice overall. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “if you like staying off the strip”
Reviews.Author: JennyistReiselustig
Reviews.Content: Let me just say I'm a "strip girl". But for once we decided to stay off the strip. It is more relaxing, but then I don't really go to Vegas to relax. The Place is very nice a welcome change from staying in the Casino, less noisy and not smokey. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo my in-laws and our 2 Kids and there was plenty on room for the six of us. And a I have to say in a place like Vegas, having a kitchen safes huge bucks! The garden and pool is absolutely gorgeous. The pool and hot tub were open, even during the coolest time in Vegas. It is about 1 mile to walk to the strip. There is also a shuttle every hour that will drop you at Harrah's, the heart of the strip. The grocery store shuttle is handy as well. So you don't really need a car:) It was nice to have the Hofbrauhaus close by, it is one of my favorite Vegas (or Munich) destinatins. Lots of fun on a Saturday night. If I go to Vegas with Kids again I would most certainly stay there. But as a adult trip I prefer the strip:)

Reviews.Title: “A fun time in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Domalu
Reviews.Content: We own a timeshare in Las Vegas but decided to stay a little closer to the strip. Check in was very smooth until they said to go over to the other desk for your "welcome gift". I knew what that was all about and i wanted to just skip it. But I went along with my husband and a very outgoing, woman proceeded to try and give us numerous free things such as shows, buffets, gambling chips for just 75 minutes of our time! I will say, after trying to politely turn her down two times, I then had to rudely say No and walk away. I understand they are sales people but they should be focusing on people who are interested in buying, not people who already own. The room was on the 6th floor and overlooked the strip. It was a beautiful view and a very spacious suite. A very very comfortable king size bed (wished I had one at home), well equipped kitchen, nice furnishings in the living room and bedroom. I was disappointed in the bathroom, as I hoped there would be a jacuzzi bath, but the shower worked great and there was immediate hot water. The weather was cool so we did not use the pool or hot tubs but the area was very nicely landscaped. We had rented a car for the week and had no problem finding a parking space and enjoyed traveling and finding our way around the city. Very close to the airport and we never heard a plane. It was a great trip and loved having the washer and dryer and being able to come home with clean laundry! Loved being close to the strip and the awesome view, I would stay here again and just by pass the sales desk!

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham is great value”
Reviews.Author: SteamboatTravelers
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our recent 4-day stay but the Resort has its flaws. Our family needed 2 beds in the second bedroom which was impossible to find with this proximity to the strip at $139/ night. We were upgraded to the 2-bedroom Presidential Suite on the 12th floor. The benefits definately outweighed the flaws for our group = thus 4-stars. BENEFITS: Our unit was on the pool side and very quiet. The full kitchen allowed us to make our own breakfast -we prefer this over complimentary breakfasts at other hotels which are pretty generic and often stop by 9 AM. How many times can you eat out and not get tired of it? The kitchen permitted us to keep snacks, beer which was so convenient. The unit had a washer/ dryer and laundry soap, dishwasher soap, salt and pepper, popcorn, lots of glasses and stem ware - I appreciate having these items. A flatscreen TV in each BR and LR. Supermarkets within a short drive, drugstore a short walk, strip was certainly walkable. We had a problem with the oven not turning off, and maintenance replaced the range by the time we returned to our room. The pool / hot tub areas outside are very nice, serene; our sons used the hot tub at about 3 AM too. We arrived very late (2 AM) and no sales pitch occured. Our sons used the shuttle to Harrahs once without problem. There was always parking and the area felt very safe. The shop on the 3rd floor had basic food items (bread, tortillas) and pharmacy type items - inflated prices though. CRITICISMS: Overall the criticisms are 'small' stuff in my evaluation. The morning after arriving, we received a 'welcome' call at 9 AM - acknowledging our 2 AM arrival - to ask us to pick up our 'welcome package' at the front desk. The call was too early, given our arrival time! We sent our young cocky adult sons to get their 'welcome package' which disappointed their sales rep, who wanted the parents! Thus, no sales pitch. The welcome package is a joke: a single toothpaste sample and shampoo sample (which the unit already had). The game room is not for adults really; it is small, a single pool table, single air hockey table, single Wei, nothing was 'complimentary'. The master bathroom's shower and single sink are open to the bedroom, so no privacy there. The only cleanliness flaw I noticed (I'm picky) was finding a clump of long dark hairs on the shower's drain - we are all blond so they weren't ours! That told me the shower floor wasn't cleaned between guests! Carts were not available for guests in Tower 2, so we had to huff our groceries from parking lot to the 12th floor ourselves and we saw others doing the same. A hotel bellboy even had an empty cart in the parking lot but wouldn't allow us to use it - he said it wasn't 'permitted' - that was annoying. SUMMARY: Despite these criticisms, we would definately stay there again. It was a great value, very nice and quiet unit and it more than met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciation But Not Love”
Reviews.Author: LLFauntleroy
Reviews.Content: It was kind of like a date arranged on online by a service that leaves you thinking it was OK, not quite sure if you want to repeat it, but realizing all the good qualities you saw. Big, spotless, well equipped apartments are undeniable. But inside towers sticking up out of parking spaces, staffed by Vegas sales people that make you want to avoid them, "no, thanks, I'm not interested in a free breakfast to endure a time share pitch". Yet, you look around at the really spacious apartment you are in. The neighbors cram six people into theirs, we are glad we are just two. But we couldn't walk to the strip, so close yet so far, on pedestrian unfriendly streets. Yet they will take you in their shuttle, they even took us one night in their limo, and you know without a doubt they really appreciate you staying with them. But we walk into Aria, Bellagio, Trump, art and fountains everywhere, and away from the casino racket, "this is what I want". Yet, they are expensive and you don't get the big roomy Wyndham apartment for less money. So, would I go out on a second date and stay here again? Probably, after all, once the romance is gone its all about practicality anyway, and this place is practical. And appeciative, and affordable. Its just not love.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: MsDeb60
Reviews.Content: I treated my grandson to Las Vegas for his 21st birthday and was blessed to be able to stay at this property in a 2-bedroom unit. From the time we entered the lobby his eyes lit up. Upon entering the unit he was in disbelief. It was simply marvelous. The staff, the property, the view, the beds and pillows, the kitchen were all above expectations. He's already planning to return to Las Vegas and looking forward to staying here. His first visit to a property of this nature has painted lasting memories for him. Everyone was so helpful. I've stayed here a few times and find it hard to go to stay anywhere else. If you are looking for a place to be treated like royalty and enjoy your stay... this is it. Free parking and WiFi. Easy access to the strip by complimentary shuttle if you're not driving.

Reviews.Title: “Another great time at the Grand Desert”
Reviews.Author: RoyR
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times now and each time has been great. A super clean, comfortable and deluxe 2 bedroom suite with Jacuzzi made this another GREAT stay in Vegas. The staff is courteous but stays out of the way unless needed. This really is a fine place to stay in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Hiskid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2-bedroom unit with another couple at this resort last week. The unit itself was cozy and very clean, the kitchen was well equipped and the location was quiet at night, away from the noise of the Strip. There is a complimentary shuttle to the Strip that is convenient and regular. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The service from this resort was outstanding-whenever we needed more coffee, and even when we asked for an additional coffee maker because some of us drink decaf and some drink regular coffee, our requests were met within the hour. They always followed up with a phone call to make sure we'd actually received what we'd called for (we've never encountered this in a resort before, and we travel a lot!). The gym was a decent size with a good variety of equipment and generally not very busy when we used it. It was too cool to use the pools when we were there, but they looked very clean and the entire grounds were well kept. The only *small* thing I could say against the unit we stayed in is that they don't seem to have fans in the bathrooms, which makes for a lot of steam when you're having a shower. If we ever return to Vegas, we'd definitely stay here again. Having a kitchen unit makes for an economical way to have breakfast and lunch, and helps the waistline too! :)

Reviews.Title: “More space than you need!”
Reviews.Author: fengshuiman
Reviews.Content: We are Grand Luxxe residence owners and wanted to try other resorts for comparison and value. The Wyndham GD was a real surprise. We had 2 bookings of 2 bedrooms on the 6th flr and was truly surprise how spacious it was for an extended family of 11. We really enjoy the resort, clean and comfortable. A truly 3 star resort with nice pools, hot tubs, lots of parking, shuttle service to the strip & insuite washer/dryer, wow! Kitchen is fully equipped & FREE wifi! You need a car to drive around. Walking is fine but when the strip is so spread out, it can be very tiring more so if you want to pick up some grocery. Highly recommended for value in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “I can't say enough good things about this property!”
Reviews.Author: BonVintage
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here at least a dozen times. The rooms are always nice! I like the one bedroom delux because it has a jacuzzi in the unit. The room we are in now in tower 2 on the 13th floor has a fabulous view of the strip! The staff is really great and they have wine tasting and champagne socials and music, games, etc; all complimentary. I love it that they don't come in and mess with my room!! They provide all the towels, etc. that one needs for your stay and I believe there is a washer and dryer in every unit. The shuttle service to the strip works effeciently and one can walk to the strip in 10 minutes from here. The first casino you come to is Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shopping center. The pools are beautiful and there is a quiet bar, store with gifty and grocery items on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location away from the craziness of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JBicrs
Reviews.Content: Some college friends and I rented a 3 bedroom timeshare for a long weekend. The unit was huge and the furniture was sturdy. It had older-style oak cabinets but they were in nice condition. I didn't stay in the master suite, but it looked incredible- almost like its own place. Kitchen was well appointed. Good parking. Really liked being away from the Strip as it is really crazy. Nice amenities and they gave us bags of ice, microwave popcorn, etc. so don't be afraid to ask. This is my first time in a timeshare property, so not sure if that is typical. I slept on the sofa bed, which was of excellent quality- very comfortable. The room could have used a bit more insulation to keep hallway noise out.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on the way to Flagstaff”
Reviews.Author: gjresh
Reviews.Content: We joined friends for a stay on our way to Wyndham Flagstaff. The property was well maintained and the two bedroom suite was lovely. This property really had many social activities and we were able to attend a champagne party on Thursday night.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: gbpackerfan62
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Grand Desert is a very nice resort just a couple blocks of the Strip. It is clean, comfortable and fairly quiet. It has a couple nice size pools and several whirpools. The grounds are kept clean and the staff is helpful. I have family that are timeshare owners through Wyndham and enjoy them. My wife and I sat down for a presentation and the condescending salesman would not take "no" for an answer. He a liar to top it off! Maybe he needs some time off to spend sharpening his sales tactics at his million dollar home in Newport Beach. Yeah Right! Beutiful resort! Stay away from sales pitch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: desserraestephens
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great staff, and great price. Not located on the strip which caused an inconvenience. But I guess that why the rate is so good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ginger1921
Reviews.Content: We own at the Grand Desert and use our points to stay there. This past time we went down the Vegas I reserved the 3 bedroom Presidential. It was extremely spacious and comfortable. I was disappointed by the way Wyndham portrays this unit however. They make it seem like you will get a suite with a terrace, however I learned that is not available. All in all, we like the location since it isn't far from the strip and you can walk through the MGM conference center into MGM to get right out on the strip if you don't want to walk the street. We're heading down again in March for our son's 21st birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Staying off of the strip in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Carol0226
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Las Vegas and our first with our youngest child and our grandson. We elected to stay off of the strip at the Wyndham Grand Desert. We were very happy with our condo and found it refreshing to get away from the noise and detractions you sometimes find on the strip. I'm glad we did this as it is apparrent that the ecomomy has effected Vegas. By far I saw more homeless people than before and the streets were less crowded but more covered with trash. Our teenage grandson was stunned by what he saw. The Wyndham was clean and the staff were great. Our units were well equiped and comfortable. The pools and other amenities were great. No complaints!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK Location- Do you like vanilla icing?”
Reviews.Author: 2Dante
Reviews.Content: This is an ok location (two very long blocks to the strip) with spacious rooms. Ideal for two couples since there is a "family/TV" room between the two bedrooms. Each had its own bathroom which made it nice. The rooms were furnished ok- probably a dated decor but the furniture was not bad. We signed up for the time-share sales pitch but ended up not going. It was cold so did not use the pool but it looked great. Especially the one for those over 18. But there was an over powering smell (aroma?) in the halls we could not identify. It was clearly put there-not something from guest cooking. After the second day we decided it was a cheap vanilla icing smell-like from a grocery store cake. Really annoying but it did not reach into the rooms. We actually heard someone on the elevator say they liked it. So, if you like strolling through a bakery before going to your room- this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “A long walk to strip”
Reviews.Author: ellendura
Reviews.Content: Great lobby and pool area. Pools and hot tubs open 24 hours. Staff very friendly. Time share push is irritating. Vouchers for free play at Harrah's are easy to use. Felt taken with show tickets. We were told we would be expected to buy a drink for 9.95 during show but were not told we would be paying another 9.00 in taxes and entertainment fees per person. Walk to strip is doable, but at night it is kind of desolate. Hard Rock Casino is actually closer. Had no issues with Internet. Unit and furnishings were adequate, nothing wow about the unit. There are different floor plans. This would be a great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Free_Skier
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay in a 2 bedroom deluxe suite through an exchange with RCI points. The unit was fabulous for 2 couples. We each had our own living space with connecting door. Both bedrooms had king sized beds. The larger unit had a full sized kitchen and jacuzzi tub. We were in Tower 3 which has its own pool and hot tub. No bar service but also didn't have any issues with taking our own beverages to the hot tub (in plastic containers though). As others said, the shuttle takes you to Harrahs and you can pick up other shuttles from there, but rental cars are not that expensive and there was lots of parking at the casinos on the strip so we pretty much drove where ever we went. Don't be afraid to use the valet parking at the casinos. There is no charge, just whatever you want to tip the valet. Only downside was the wait for the car, but you would otherwise be walking to the parking garage or waiting for a taxi. They do provide you with lotion, shampoo and conditioner which is not always a given in timeshare units. Also there are no robes in the rooms, another item that is not consistent with timeshare units. The units come equipped with a coffee sample for 1 pot of coffee, paper towels and small salt and peppers. We never had any problems parking our car at the resort. Even late at night there were stil spots available. We arrived quite early and the check in girls were able to give us our room which was greatly appreciated after our early morning flight from Calgary. We settled into our room and then hit the strip. The girls did some shopping at the Forum Shops while the boys spent the better part of the day at the Sports Book at Ceasar's. Found some pretty good sales at the Forum Shops which made it an affordable shopping experience. We returned to our rooms for a hot tub and to pick up our parking pass. (if you like betting on horse races the best sports book we found was off the strip at Sam's Town) At no time did we get approached for a time share presentation which we really appreciated. We never had cause to use the Concierge services so cannot comment on that. The resort is very clean and there is almost always someone busy cleaning something. If you have a chance you have to check out City Centre. The complex is very interesting and well worth a walk through and drink at the Chandelier Bar. We have stayed at the Jockey Club before because of its location on the strip but our future trips to Las Vegas will be to the Grand Desert, it is a beautiful resort..

Reviews.Title: “We love our trips to Wyndham Grand Desert”
Reviews.Author: kmbyopie
Reviews.Content: We have spent long weekends, short weekend and a full week at the Grand Desert since we became owners in 2001 and it is a go to property for us. But, in May 2010 the whole family (wife, kids, in-laws, my parents, my brother, his friend) spent 7 days in the desert. We love the Grand Desert. Lots of floor plans, plenty of pools and spas, onsite food and drinks along with well appointed rooms. It is a short drive, or longer walk, to the strip but far enough away to allow the whole family to enjoy the facility without being bombarded with neon and solicitations! The staff has always been one of the best crews we run across in our Wyndham travels. It is just a great place to stretch out and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 3 Days at the Grand Desert!”
Reviews.Author: susienew
Reviews.Content: First off, through Alamo Car Rental as as member of their Alamo Insiders for great promotions, we took advantage of their 25% and an additional $30 off deal. We ended up paying for just three days, only the taxes and fees on our intermediate size Ford Fusion - a total of $19.56. That was it! The many times we used taxi service to the Grand Desert from LAS, we were easily burned for over $25 plus. The return trip to the airport was always around $15. (Go figure.) We used the Grand Desert's shuttle to Harrahs once but it was so much easier to just take the car and park it free at Harrahs. What a timeserver. Customer service at the Grand Desert was absolute perfection. Elizabeth at the front desk was so friendly, so sweet, and helpful. Our 2 bedroom deluxe wasn't ready yet when we arrived at 11am so she found us another one higher up on the 12th floor, corner unit. We loved it with a view of the strip and so quiet. From the smiling doormen to the maids, to the timeshare counter, everyone was professional and went out of their way to help you. We enjoyed our timeshare presentation, getting it in the same day at 12 noon to avail ourselves of their complimentary lunch of meatballs, riggatoni, and salad. For the 45 minute owner's update we received free premium tickets to Jersey Boys (at least a $200 savings) at the Venetian that evening. We were off to a great start on our first day in Vegas. We have always enjoyed the Grand Desert, especially the deluxe units. The king bed was luxurious and so comfortable. The bathrooms were very nice with amenities and with soft towels and the kitchen with granite counter tops fully stocked with kitchen ware. With the car we went to the local Vons and bought some wine, cheese, fruit for our romantic evenings. The heater was a little loud when it came on but it was brief. The lobby was quite beautiful, decked out with holiday decorations. The grounds were well maintained and easy to find parking for our rental. Everything was just cheery and lovely. We will always return to the Grand Desert. Tops in our eyes!

Reviews.Title: “Nice condo option but avoid sales presentation”
Reviews.Author: mexicocity
Reviews.Content: We booked this property as part of timeshare promotion through RCI where we are owners. The property is relatively new, well maintained and furnished tastefully. We stayed in a one bedroom. I thought it had an odd layout with the bathroom off the enterance instead of near the bedroom. The appliances are apartment size and contractor grade but everything works well. We had no issues with the internet. The grounds are quite nice, however the pools are located in the courtyard surrounded by buildings and get very little direct sunlight, if you are traveling during shoulder season you may find it too cool to swim. The gym is great. There is a market, bar and a couple of quick service restaurants on property. While we escaped our sales presentation quickly our friends were not so lucky. Even though they had no interest it took over 90 minutes. I did not find the staff friendly or helpful. Location is great walkable to the strip if you are so inclined, cabs available all the time, they run a shuttle to Harrahs but if your time in Vegas is short I would advise against the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Ngaire1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 5 days ago for a trip in February 2012. I made a mistake in the dates, by one day (I want the same number of nights, just starting and ending one day later). As soon as I realised the mistake (when I got the formal booking notice) I contacted the hotel. They will not change the reservation even though it is for a less busy night, and three months in advance. In fact they say I can not even add an additional day! Obviously they care little or nothing about their customers! I will NEVER stay at a Wyndham hotel again. Incidentally, I clicked on one of the boxes below and can not unclick them for some reason. I have no idea how good the actual hotel is, and I am hoping not to find out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the smoke free facility”
Reviews.Author: Kelly W
Reviews.Content: The casinos in Vegas are rightfully known for being smokey. The Wyndham Grand Desert is a mile off of the strip but it was so nice to walk into a smoke free facility. We booked though Vacation Rentals by Owners and were very satisfied with our experience. We got exactly what we paid for, the king bed was luxurious, the second bedroom had two nice queen beds, there were 3 big TV's in the suite. But on your walking shoes or use the shuttle, the Wyndham is a nice alternative to strip life.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Retreat in the Busy City - Great Holiday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Kate B
Reviews.Content: I spent Thanksgiving at the Wyndham Grand Desert and have nothing but raves about the property and the staff. My sister and I shared a one bedroom suite on the 8th floor in the Bella Torre tower. Our room looked out toward the strip. Situated on Koval and Harmon this resort near all things Vegas without the hustle and bustle of being right on the strip. If you want to skip the strip- the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino is just down the street . We had our turkey dinner across town at the Rio and the next night visited the Hof Brau House which is just down the street from the Wyndham. Parking was easy and there was plenty of it even with a FULL house. Even though there were a lot of families including kids- they were quiet. The cuisinart small appliances got a workout from us- loved the coffee pot, microwave and blender in the room. Only complaint- the sofa bed was shot. Sis and I ended up sharing the big queen bed in the bedroom. The crisp elegant bedding was comfortable and we had plenty of room. Washer and dryer in the room meant we took home clean clothes. Our fault- we left a bag behind. This morning Katie in Lost and Found called me back and it is on its way home for a small UPS charge- thanks Katie! I will be happy to come back over and over- next time I do want to come off peak so I can enjoy the strip without quite so many crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Sales Pitch”
Reviews.Author: Tim P
Reviews.Content: Although a very clean and attractive hotel, my wife and I were disappointed with the fact that we were tricked into believing that we would receive a free breakfast and a free gift(a $100.00 American Express gift card or a $150.00 voucher for casino gambling), if we agreed to attend a brief sales presentation on vacation ownership at this hotel. Being current RCI owners, we thought we knew what to expect. Wrong. They led us through parking garages and other buildings with us meeting 4 different people and having to prove our identity(they already knew who we were after having checked into the hotel) before we saw anything and being told to wait till we were called. At that point, I had had enough, and refused to go any further. It was already much longer than breakfast should take and I didn't see where there was any place for breakfast. I asked to speak to the manager and when he finally got back to me an hour later, he claimed he was sorry for the misunderstanding and that we should have been told by the person signing us up of what to expect. He offered nothing, even though his member services representative promised that we would still receive the free gift of our choice due to the misunderstanding. From then on, day 1, we felt the service was cold and there was no further attempt by any hotel representative to make sure our vacation was enjoyable or comfortable. Phone in unit did not work properly(loose line connection) and we were locked out of the room safe on two occasions requiring us to wait for repair service. Overall, the lack of consideration for our time and comfort was overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare scare!”
Reviews.Author: ShakinandAce
Reviews.Content: We have been timeshare owners with RCI for about 4 years now and booked through RCI for our trip to Vegas at the Wyndhamd Grand Desert. Overall the hotel is very nice, pools and workout room is great. The staff is excellent. It's about 2 blocks from the strip. Even though we already own a timeshare, we were begged to attend a 1 hour maximum "presentation". As feared, it was a plot to sell us ANOTHER timeshare. We were threatened that if we did not buy the $15,000 (U.S.) timeshare, that our names would be flagged in RCI's system (because Wyndham owns RCI) and we would be charged higher booking fees in the future. We are currently waiting to hear back, in writing, from RCI to see if this is true, as we didn't have a spare $15,000 to spend because we are still paying off our original timeshare. If you're a timeshare owner, don't attend the meeting then they can't "flag you" in their system. One other downfall was the "in room wireless internet". We heard the typical timeshare resort excuse "currently upgrading". Internet worked sometimes. Very frustrating. However, if you don't need in room internet, the resort was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Vegas Without Vegas Crowds”
Reviews.Author: West_Coast_Couple
Reviews.Content: Just had a great stay in 1 bdrm unit in Nov, 2011. Best trip to Vegas yet for accomodations. Definately 4-5 star. We will be coming back. Very well furnished unit. Extremely comfortable. Very, very helpful and friendly staff. Quiet and not typical with NO Vegas hectic crowds. Free parking & Internet. Shuttle/limo to strip every 20 min. Other reviews were critical of being off strip and stranded w/o car. That is the way Vegas is even if you are on the strip, as hotels can be located far apart and a bunch of walking, taxi, or shuttle rides are necessary anyway. Vegas is always best with a car. Only comment that may be neagtive is limited menu of snack shop at hotel. There is no typical hotel restaurant; but this is most common with timeshares anyway. Yoiu can take the free limo to the strip and find several very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suite, friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: jmik66
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 1 bedroom suite with the amenities of a condo. Fitness room well equipped and clean. Location is just off strip and has easy access without the hassle of the strip traffic. Only drawback is that the food and beverage options on site are not very good. Great pools. Staff are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: DJTTraveler
Reviews.Content: Attention to detail and welcoming staff. The room we stayed in was very clean. We are Wyndham Owners and this is a great property to stay at with or without the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: Donrosel
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this resort for my husband and son's birthdays. It was a very large and comfortable 2 bedroom 2 bath unit with a full kitchen. We didn't cook (Who does in Vegas?) but found the kitchen useful for happy hour, etc. The beds were very comfy and the master bathroom was huge. We didn't hear any noise from surrounding units, which made our stay even more pleasant. The only complaints: Water pressure in shower was poor and no opening windows. Fresh air is nice compared to constant air conditioning. Yes, we had to run the air conditioner in November because of the southern facing windows. The unit got quite warm. Thank goodness they had ceiling fans in each room! The property is about 2 blocks from the strip, which was also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: evakama
Reviews.Content: Great customer service, clean rooms, lots of space, hot tube and free Internet. Dish washer, kitchen, frigider, 2 bathrooms. Such a nice and easy way to travel in Vegas, close to the strip. They also have a shuttle to the strip that leaves every half-hour so that guest don't have to drive. You can find less expensive rooms on the strip but they tend to be noisy and smoky. one detail: no balcony and you have to go out every time you wanna to take a cigarette

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Line”
Reviews.Author: bikefoxx
Reviews.Content: This property is lovely well run and restful. There is some noise from the airport, but I imagine that must be true of many hotels in Vegas. The pools looked great, but the weather turned too cold to use them. The grounds are lovely. We asked for a room with a jacuzzi, and we asked for a view of the strip, we got neither. They said they were full, but from the looks of the parking and just looking at the rooms with or without lights, it did not look full. The beds are ok, they have that "ridge" of the edge before you get in them, if you know what I mean. They have old style tv's in the bedroom and new flat screens in the living room.

Reviews.Title: “1st class oasis!”
Reviews.Author: lmahaffie
Reviews.Content: This was a quite respite from the downtown noise and lights. The entrance and staff are 1st class and we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was beautiful and quite. We felt pampered with all the amenities available and we were not pressured to listen to the sales pitch when we chose not to participate in the tour of time shares. This is truly a first class oasis!

Reviews.Title: “Nice size hotel, clean and no casino”
Reviews.Author: SMR1965
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Wyndham Grand Dessert for a business trip to Vegas. I didn't want the hassle of staying on the strip at one of the huge resort properties. I was a little concerned that I'd get hit with a sales pitch since this is a vacation ownership property, but thankfully I did not. The room was great - it had a living area with an adjoined, fully-equipped kitchen, a separate bedroom, a separate bathroom and a washer/dryer. The property was very clean and the staff was friendly. There's no restaurant on the property - only a small deli for sandwiches, pizza and breakfast. The general store had a decent selection of snacks that were very reasonably priced. The fitness center was great! The treadmills, ellipticals and bikes were relatively new, and there was a nice selection of free weights and machines. As hotel fitness centers go, this one ranks among the highest. I was able to get in a full workout, both cardio and weights, every day I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Well, I'm here at the Grand Desert!”
Reviews.Author: OBE94347
Reviews.Content: I'm reserving my final review of this "time share" dealy until I get home, but I just thought I'd send out a shout to all the TA friends waiting, with bated-breath, for the low-down on this Las Vegas gem (their description) One cannot evaluate a venue like this without taking into consideration the time-share dynamic. I got some advice from TA friends on the "lay-of-the-land," so to speak, but I have other sources from whom I seek advice, namely, owners of Wyndham Timeshares. I'm a Discovery owner, that means I gave Wyndham $3000, approximately 12 months in advance of my enjoying one-minute of occupancy at one of their locations. On the day we arrived, we checked-in and were directed to the concierge desk across the lobby to procure a parking sticker for our rent-a-car. Now, our day had begun at 3:30 am due to the shock to our bio-rhythms by the daylight-saving-time switch the day before, i.e. we normally awake at 4:30 but this day were up an hour early. We both had to work on Monday, but decided to get a jump on the week by hopping on a 6pm flight out of PHL after putting-in a full day's work. The five-and-a-half hour flight was like a root canal. In fact, I would have preferred the root-canal (which usually last no more than an hour) to this skull-busting ordeal. We survived the flight, and the marathon which followed, as we trod from one end of LAS to the other retrieving our bags and then back to pick up our rent-a-car, arriving at Wyndham at about 11pm (2am our time) We were in our 24th waking hour when we walked up to the concierge desk. I mentioned earlier that visiting the concierge desk seemed urgent because we had to mark our rental car so that it wouldn't be towed. Otherwize we would have gone right up to our rooms. It seems that the parking authorization is merely a "red herring" used by the high-pressure sales-people, to get you signed-up for a meeting with other high-pressure sales types the next day. This gal starts pointing, with her pencil, to all the items on a list of wonderful benefits they will be "giving" us during our stay, like a school teacher talking to 4th grade students. My wife is staring out the window at the bellmen, as they greet car after car of guests returning from a night out-on-the-town, when this chick says, "Would you like to come over here and listen to this so that tomorrow you won't have to ask your husband what it's all about. Sweetie gave her a look of restrained scorn and muttered, "I'm going to bed!" All the signs are there, every time you talk to them. They insist on both husband and wife being present or they won't give you the time of day! That's because if they convince one member of a legal couple to buy their wares, it's worthless. They need both. As you can see, the assault starts as soon as you set foot on the property and they never let up. I just got off the phone with one seeking to set up a meeting tomorrow for lunch. She said they were going to "give" us a $150 American Express just for having lunch with them. In my case, they'll be trying to get me to become a full-fledged owner. But it doesn't stop there. They even try to get owners to raise the ante by buying greater valued time-shares. As I said, it's only day-2 of our 6-day stay. More later.

Reviews.Title: “Private Oasis away from the Hustle”
Reviews.Author: ChattyKate
Reviews.Content: This is a great location just 2 blocks from the strip. The units in the time share property are very clean, new and fully stocked. The property has an excellent gym and a spa/massage therapy facility. Take a massage in the "Full Spectrum Massage" under the caring hands of "Andy" - Andrea. Andy has the therapeutic touch that will melt away stress and she will identify areas of concern and she will apply her therapeutic magically touch. I had a very bad back after flying for 6 hrs and being under stress from a recent family members passing away. Andy listened and acted on my complain. She is caring, empathetic, and honest in nature but remains professional, and competent. She uses her hands to search out and treat. I had 2 massages and by the end of the week was feeling my old self again. Full Spectrum Massage is top-knotch and Andy is a jewel! The property will provide the much needed rest and relaxation needed after a long day on the town or a trip to the Grand Canyon. Enjoy-ChattyKate.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: zippy9
Reviews.Content: The property itself is beautiful - we were in vegas for a convention and brought along our two small kids and this was a really nice property for the kids yet close to the strip for us. We had a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom and it was really beautiful, very spacious, new with good service. They had a full size crib and a highchair which I have to say is FANTASTIC (no extra charge). I would have rated this 5 star and to be honest we really considered purchasing a timeshare - until we went to the presentation. These guys are aggressive and rude. When we asked for an information package so we could review everything and think about we were told - 'No'. Their attitude was enough to make us not want to invest. I would recommend this property and I would recommend going through sunorsnow vacation rentals - they were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “A stones throw from the action!!”
Reviews.Author: Danny D
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week in vegas . Myself and 4 friends spent the last part of the trip (4 nights ) at the Wyndham . In a nutshell - fantastic ! , the rooms, pools and everything around the place are spotless , clean and tidy . Its a good 10 minute walk to get down to the strip taking you past planet hollywood westgate and eventually arriving at the new city centre area , or you can grab a cab for around ten bucks including a small tip . we once treated ourselves to the Wyndham stretch limo and took a ride down to fremont street for 30 bucks ! well worth it . Back to to the hotel , the rooms are superbly equipt with everything you need right down to a washer / dryer , not to mention a huge hot tub ! For me there was no hassle from any timeshare sellers and the customer service on all aspects was great . i would like to highly recommend using the the tour desk to book tours / shows etc Hellene was her name great service was her game ! basically i cant see how you could go wrong with a stay here , especially if you have children and are looking for low key set up but not to far out . Although there is a tiny room with a few games inside i would regard this as a non gaming property where you can take a welcome rest from the dazzling strip! All in all recommended ! Dan Denson , England.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: joinkb
Reviews.Content: After my husband and I read several reviews we were satisfied with our choice for staying in Vegas for our birthdays. We went with another couple and had a 2 bedroom in tower 1, room 711. Very nice but a little small for a 2 bedroom, however it still took care of our needs for 4 adults! It gave us enough room to relax, but who stays in their room anyway in Vegas? Check in was smooth and uneventful and I was only bothered once about attending a timeshare presentation. I did hear something I have not confirmed. When I told the lady we were as already timeshare owners using RCI she told me that's good cause Wyndham now owns RCI. This is something I've never heard of, if anyone can confirm this please let us know!! Other than that the grounds were beautiful and this place smelled lovely!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but not on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: anjeldoll77
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Vegas and stayed here October 16-20/2011. The hotel is beautiful. We had a 3-bedroom condo (time-share) that overlooked the Las Vegas strip. It was not a quick walk if you want to walk everywhere. The staff was great. Every time we called for something we received a call back to see if it was delivered. They drove us around from tower to tower on golf carts as needed. The hotel provided a courtesy limo that took us around in the city. As far as the amenities, they were great. In our condo, there was a full kitchen with a microwave, refrigerator, stove, dishwasher and all the dishes needed. The master bedroom had a Jacuzzi tub. The beds were comfortable, linen clean. We had a dining room, den and laundry area. There were nice flat screens in each bedroom and the den. The hotel provided an activity calendar as well. They provided a grocery shopping trip, a trip to the outlet mall and to the Welcome to Las Vegas sign for pictures. Of course these trips were a slight cost, but not too bad. The pool area was nice and quiet and relaxing. I have no complaints. Check in and check out was very convienient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Far Walk!”
Reviews.Author: Karlyforet
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel, nice rooms, gourgeous pool and hot tubs!! Only dislike its a short ways to walk to the strip. Have to take a bus/ taxi everytime we wanted to go back to the strip, to casino's, ect.

Reviews.Title: “Private adult retreat”
Reviews.Author: Windmill47
Reviews.Content: The resort is incredibly gorgeous and has lots of activities if you are not just there to gamble.They have jewelery & t-shirt making and various other crafts for nominal fees. ( $2-$9). They also have a free shuttle available to take you to the strip ( drops you at the back of Harrah's-runs until 10 pm) every day. Concierge on staff terrific for info!! They even have an adult only pool, which they really do enforce adults only!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Grand Desert”
Reviews.Author: mum2lc
