Reviews.Content: We always have a wonderful week at this resort. The pools are clean, good size and one is for adults while another zero entry is for families. They have upgraded the pool lounge chairs and they are upscale looking and better quality than previous ones. The sun hits the pool area for a perfect amount of time for sunbathing. Some resorts are situated poorly and block the sun or you have to keep moving throughout the day. They usually play music at the pool which is a treat in my opinion! Sometimes live musicians but mostly recorded music. There is a sundries shop to pick up a few food or personal items as well as a little cafe area. The game room is large and inviting. Great for families. Our last stay was a two bedroom presidential and it was gorgeous! Decidedly upscale furnishings, very comfortable beds, large windows, stone countertops, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: OntarioRacer10
Reviews.Content: A beautiful condo located about two blocks off The Strip. Easy access to all the activities on Las Vegas Blvd. We just got back from a one week stay in Tower #3 and had stayed in Tower #1 about three years ago. Never wanted for anything as the condo unit was stocked to our satisfaction. We were not bothered at all by anyone promoting the "sales pitch" for timeshare ownership. We lounged at the pool adjacent to Tower 3 during a couple of mornings and found the pool to be adequate although not very deep and the hot tub was wonderful. An excellent experience and would recommend the Wyndham to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Oct 2nd thur Oct 9th”
Reviews.Author: Larry R
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews about this resort once my wife booked our week and was concerned about a few things. Overall our experience was okay. Nothing too bad, but I do have some comments to share that may or may not go along with others that have commented. Check in was easy, but you just have to so NO to the sales pitch you have to listen to in order to obtain your parking pass. If you're interested in being trapped for "30 minutes" for a dinner or show, then it's up to you. Once we said no, (and never answered the phone) we had no problems with sales people. One down side about this resort (and most likely others) is the number of prospective buyers they parade around the campus and through the pool area. There was always a flow of traffic through this area. As for the pools (3 of them), they are limited to the amount of sun they receive. I only experienced the two main pools between building 1 and 2. The "family" pool receives sun around 10am to 2pm and the adult pool from 2-4pm (at least in Oct). So, depending on your plans, you're very limited to the sun exposure, or have to relocate in the afternoon which can become very crowed and a struggle for the sunny areas. Pools were nice, music okay. Just too many folks walk through on the tours. One nice amenity we used was the parking garage (not originally told about when we ck'd in). It was convenient, but very tight parking. The downside is the sales folks park in the "no Parking / tow-away" zones which can block cars in and make it very difficult to get out. We didn't use the spa facilities or any of the restaurants. We did use the fitness facility in our building and it was well equipped and very nice. We also didn't use the shuttle service, sorry no help. I guess the biggest compliant overall would be the noise from the airport. No matter which direction flights are taking off, it's very noise (inside and outside) Loud enough to drown out the music at the pool. So, keep this in mind. If you're looking for long, quiet days by the pool, forget it. Overall, the rooms were big, kitchen was "okay" (lots of drawers sticking due to poor design), but manageable. I would recommend during the busy time as there's just not enough room at the pools to manage the crowds because people relocate from one to the other so it's really like having one pool in use at a time. The 3rd pool was small and appeared crowded, but we never visited it's location. Although our experience wasn't bad, we probably would not stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet and Relaxing Time”
Reviews.Author: AlreadyTakenMd
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went in August 2010. The place was extremely clean and updated. All the amenities needed were at our feet. We had to call for service if we needed anything. Otherwise they left us alone to enjoy ourselves. The computer room is free. The game room was nice and a calendar full of activities was available in the game room. Shuttle buses free, came all day long starting at 7am to take you different places throughout Las Vegas. I purchased tickets to a show at the front desk. There were times that my hotel door card was deactivated and I had to get another card but no matter how many times I needed assistance, the service was nice. The pool side activities was friendly and the hot tube conversations were an added plus. I can't say enough about it. My friend was glad to come back to the quiet hotel after a noisy time on the Las Vegas strip. Places to eat: Rio, Voodoo, Eiffel Tower restaurant. Places to see: every hotel on the strip has something for your camera to snap. Must go to the Hoover Dam, Grand Canyon! The Lions King was great! I had a great time and plan on returning with family members.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: HagMD
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Wyndham Grand Desert and it was wonderful. The place is beautiful and the shuttle and taxi services were so convenient, we didn't mind being "off strip". The pool areas were quiet and relaxing. A nice change from the busy (sometimes dirty) strip. Everyone we encountered was extremely nice and helpful. The timeshare people didn't even hassle us when we turned down the "opportunity" to attend one of their sessions. We took advantage of the shuttle to the grocery (which sure saved money based on the prices at the marketplace) and took the 4 hour bus trip to Red Rock Canyon. The driver/guide was exceptional. I would highly recommend it to my friends and family for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Yet!”
Reviews.Author: m1davis
Reviews.Content: We drove from Michigan to Las Vegas in July, 2010 for my friends wedding. My dad is actually the one that set up the reservation for my fiance and I. After the LONG car ride, we were more than happy to be in Vegas. Since it was our first time in Vegas, we didn't know what to expect. When we go there the staff was very friendly even with it being rather busy. After getting our room number, we were a little confused about where to go, but eventually we figured it out. I felt like I had hit the jackpot when we walked into the room! We had sort of a strip view from our room, which I loved! I thought that the location was great, we still got the action of Vegas, but without the hassle of the strip. The first day we walked everywhere we went, which, in the middle of July in Vegas, not a good idea. But then we discovered the shuttle that took us to Harrah's on the strip and then we ventured from there. I only have two problems with our stay. One, I didn't really care for the food that was there at the cafe. I tried a few different things and I just wasn't impressed. And secondly, it just wasn't a long enough stay! I would recommend this resort to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, at the end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: TravelCouple26
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham was a very nice, quiet hotel. It is near the airport, at the end of the strip. The hotel offers a free shuttle to Harrah's from about 8 am to 10 pm at night. This was a pretty good way to get to the strip. We took a cab back to the hotel at the end of the night. We stayed in a two bedroom suite (2 BR, 2 BA, kitchen, living room, dining room). Our room overlooked the airport :-( , but we didn't spend much time in our room so it wasn't too bad. The complex was beautiful and well maintained. They have a family and an adult only pool as well. There is a cafe to get quick meals at and they have a small grocery store where you can get essentials.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but prefer closer to casinos”
Reviews.Author: Hennipenny
Reviews.Content: This resort was very large but very nice. The pool and spa areas were especially appealing. If you are going to stay here, be sure to bring a bathing suit. We didn't as we thought the weather would be too hot however, it wasn't as hot and the pools were so inviting. We had a two bedroom suite with a full kitchen and two bathrooms. We were in the main tower and there are two other towers. Beds were comfortable and the rooms we had overlooked the pool (no balconies). The hotel has a shuttle that goes to Harrah's at center strip which is convenient but crowded. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and check-in and out was very efficient. Since it is a timeshare you should expect to be offered the timeshare presentation. The only drawback with this resort for our party is its proximity to the strip and restaurants since you have to drive, take the shuttle or a cab.

Reviews.Title: “A rookies perspective”
Reviews.Author: tip70ton
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st time to Las Vegas. I decided to stay off the strip in order to take advantage of renting condo type accomodations for the space. It was an excellent decision. Loved the Wyndham Grand Desert. I rented from someone via vrbo. Two bdrm deluxe - 2 bedrooms, 2 full baths, full kitchen, dining area and living area. This was perfect for our Girls Getaway for 4 adults. It was important to us for everyone to have their own bed as well as stay in one room. There was a king bed, 2 full/queen size beds and the pullout couch. The condo was clean and spacious. We were able to go to our own spaces and have girl time in the living and dining room. The space was fresh and clean. We didn't care about having every day maid service. We're neat and tidy folks so it didn't make as any difference. We called for more towels, coffee and new iron. It was brought to us w/in 20-30 minutes. They always called back to make sure we received the items we requested which was a great touch of customer service. The service at this location was spot on. We didn't have any problems. The security was great as well. You had to use your room key at all times to get to your floor. In the evenings you could see security walking the grounds to make sure everything was in order. Since we were 4 females traveling this gave us great sense of security. By choice I attended a timeshare. I never attend these but I thought what the heck. I'm seriously considering purchasing DVC thru Disney World and I wanted something to compare it to and this gave me a solid comparison. It's also a nice product if you're looking to purchase a timeshare. I was there approximately 2 1/2 hours. I had a talker and I seriously was interested in finding out the facts and number crunching. The guy I had talked loud and a mile a minute. That drove me crazy but I did get the information I needed. Had it been a normal sales person the experience would have been more pleasant and it probaly would have only taken 2 hours. Absolutely no pressure when I told him I was not interested. He asked why and I told him i was still leaning towards Disney and we were finished. O and there was not any pressure for me to sign up for the timeshare either. It was my own freewill choice. The first time on the strip we walked from the resort. That was the 1st and last time we walked. Yes, it's only about a 10 minute walk to the strip but the street, Harmon is a major street and I don't care to walk down major streets - it just doesn't seem safe to me. Walking there was cool but it's the walk back that changed our minds to drive. After a long day of walking on the strip the last thing we wanted to do was walk back to the resort. We soon realized that valet parking at any resort on the strip was free. All you have to do is tip them. After learning this we drove everywhere. We rented a car because we were going to Hoover Dam. So it wasn't any extra expense to use the car. We enjoyed staying here because it felt like we got away from it all at the end of the day to our quiet little condo. Loved it!!! They do offer a shuttle service. We did not use it. We do not like to wait for shuttles so we opted out of this service. They give you a slip of paper to use to get on and off the shuttle. The shuttle picks you up at the hotel and delivers you to the Harrah casino. It's located more on the north side of the strip. The shuttle to Harrah's stops at 10pm. At the that time you can catch Rio's shuttle and they will take you back to the strip up until 12:30AM believe. We decided next time we would stay on the strip, rent two connecting rooms and not rent a car. Grand Desert was fabulous and met our needs but because we understand actually staying on the strip would be more convenient for us we would opt for the strip next time. Things to consider if you stay at Grand Desert It is not on the strip. It is not a hop, skip and jump to the strip. It is a solid 10 minute walk, down a busy street to the strip. If you do not like walking, do not like to be shuttled to and fro and do not rent a car you will more than likely not want to stay at this resor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hookem
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with my stay at the Wyndham. I am not a resort owner, I just wanted a hotel to stay in for a week in Vegas. This was more like an apartment with frige, w&d, dw, mw, jacuzzi, and everything else needed to make you comfortable. Very spacious, nice decor, very friendly and helpful staff, couple hundred cable channels, cool views of the city and lots of activities. I can't say enough good things about my stay there including the location. Shuttle takes you to and from strip, walking distance to many other hotels but my favorite spot to eat and have a few micro brews was Ellis Island which is only a couple of blocks away. Great job by all of the staff, including the shuttle drivers and activity people. I personally don't like maids coming to your room every day so the choice of not having them come by was nice. Wireless internet was a little slow but computer room let you do everything you need to do like print out airline pass. $13 each way from airport and if you want to go furthur than the strip all day bus passes are $7.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: EJKC
Reviews.Content: The resort was nice and close to the strip about a ten minute walk. The rooms were very comfortable even the pull out bed in the couch was nice. The large garden tub was a nice touch. I liked that you could have all the excitment of the strip and come back to relaxing quiet at the resort. I really liked that the resort was non smoking except for outdoor designated areas. The food and drink prices in the gift shop were high. They do offer a shuttle to a supermarket for a small fee. It is a bit rushed as you only have about and hour to figure out what you want to get and pay for it to make it back to the shuttle. They also offered shuttle to the strip they dropped you off at Harrahs which is in the heart of the strip. They shuttles don't run very late however so be prepared to walk back or take a cab. If you stay here and aren't a owner be prepared to set through a timeshare presentation but just start your watch and stick to your guns and your done in an Hour or so. I would return to this resort next time im in vegas. Nice ammenities and its family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Been a Few Times Before - Worth Staying At”
Reviews.Author: jcasillas623
Reviews.Content: Although the room we had this time was not the best (it had a very weird smell to it), the staff was EXTREMELY quick to resolve the problem. They offered to move us or to "bomb" the room with a huge machine that smelled like Febreeze. They were also very apologetic which showed that they actually cared to acknowledge the mistake. I respect their staff for their attentiveness and rapid action that they took to remedy the situation. Besides the room itself (which is completely stocked with kitchen, living room, washer/dryer, etc), the resort is very nice and has a few amenities. The pools and gym are very nice. The resort is off the strip, but offers a shuttle. It's around 2 blocks away from the Planet Hollywood Resort and also from the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, decent location, fun trip”
Reviews.Author: brebear3
Reviews.Content: We used our Wyndham timeshare points to get 2 rooms for the weekend. We got a 2bdrm delux and a 1bdrm standard. there were 11 of us. Rooms: very nice, super clean, what you would expect from a upperclass hotel/resort. The 2bdrm delux was really spacious, the 1bdrm standard was pretty small. There were 11 of us (4 in the 1 bdrm, 7 in the 2 brdm) but we all hung out and celebrated in the 2bdrm and there was plenty of space. Pool: spent one afternoon at the pool, it was nice and the bar was good. Although, "trivia" left a bit to be desired. Really nice that there was an adult pool and a kids pool. I'm a fan of kids, just not during my pool time in Vegas. Location: it's near Planet Hollywood and the miracle mile shops so that was nice. Also not too far from Hard Rock and Terribles. If you stay here walk to the Hofbrauhaus for dinner -- super fun! we'll be back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay -- Great Place -- NIce Location”
Reviews.Author: FoxTraveler
Reviews.Content: Overview: Stay here always as we are Wyndham owners and truly love the location, the rooms and the resort amenities. Always relaxing to have a room w/kitchen and in-room washer & dryer to help make the saty a great one -- of course winning $$$ helps a lot! Easy to get to/from the airport and there is a shuttle that takes you to/from Harrahs. This is an "owner-ship" resort so If you are visiting (or an owner) you will be asked to take a 30-minute timeframe to meet and get some information -- be aware that it is a presentation and go in knowing that -- we stayed twice in the past month and received a $150 worth of food vouchers and the 2nd stay a $125 Amex card.....well worth our time. We went into the meetings informing all we were not in a position to purchase/upgrade and were done in 30-minutes. So you decide what your time is worth....ours was $275 when all was said and done. It is Vegas! Tip: Best BBG Ribs is Ellis Island Casino 3-minutes from the resort. get the players card and you can get a full-rack of ribs for $12.00. Best in town! Wyndham has a free limousine service for the (gold/platinum level users) and you simply tip the driver -- great benefit and you must book 24-hours in advance. Great way to get to a show. If you need grocieries drive toward SouthPoint Casino and go to the Food 4 Less grocery store for the best prices if you are stocking up for the week. Also the SouthPoint casino is a very good place (lots of locals) to gamble.....we did good there on the slots. Will always stay at the Wyndham as it has everything we need and the staff is very accomodating. Tip:

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment, shame about the timeshare hard sell.”
Reviews.Author: caitlinsmun
Reviews.Content: Really nice 2 bed apartment with all mod cons. Beds very comfortable and apartment was spotlessly clean. Pool was nice but a bit boring for older children as they have no slides and they can't use the larger pool until they are 18. A really nice haven away from the hustle and bustle of the Las Vegas strip whilst being very close. The teenagers loved the gamesroom which had xbox and wii games. Dvd rental was also good. Wifi was poor on the 10th floor - coonection was poor and patchy, it worked early in the morning then it went off. We paid for the connection $7 (as per the instruction in the room information) and then found out it was free. PC access was available free in the computer room. No restaurant on site but a cafe for snacks and breakfast. The check in process was really smooth but you have to collect your car park pass from the timeshare staff on another desk across the lobby. I then had to endure the timeshare hard sell which after a 10 hour flight with 3 children, was no joke. The hard sell included telling the children about the great 'free' show tickets we could all have if we attended the timeshare breakfast or lunch. I gave in and agreed to attend the meeting the following day but it turned out not to be convenient and we didn't go. I was then subject to several follow up calls and in the end we stopped answering the phone. We booked this accomodation as an exchange with our Disney timeshare, I would not do this again due the timeshare issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Wyndham”
Reviews.Author: Riviera_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham for one week. It was our second time at this resort. We liked it as much as the first time if not more. The resort is about a 15-20 min walk to the strip (depending how fast you walk and the traffic lights). The resort also offers a free shuttle to the strip - to Harrah's. The unit was perfect - freshly cleaned carpets, nice furniture, working AC (a must), etc. The resort as many activities for guests. One of which is grocery shopping. A few times a week, you can take a shuttle to the grocery strore. Registration is required. It costs $4 per person and you have about 45 min to shop. There are 3 pools (1 is reserved for adults 18+) and a number of hot tubs. The pool in tower 3 is open 24h/day. We plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: aclampkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights in August 2011. The other reviews were spot on. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The three pools are very nice. The rooms were well kept and spacious. From what I understand, all the rooms have been updated with granite countertops in the kitchen and baths. My kids ages 6,4,and 2 loved the place. The game room was more than enough to keep them busy. My only major concern about this place was the exaggerated prices in the market and sandwich place. One hotdog was $5.99/tax. A small box of cereal was $5.99/tax. A dozen of eggs was $3.99/tax. One quarter of butter was $1.99/tax. You get my point. They do have a shuttle that takes you to the supermarket every morning for a $4/pp fee. The only problem is that it fills up rather quickly and you might not have a spot on shuttle. One of the bell hops was kind enough to ask the limo driver if he would take us. He did and we gave him a $20 tip for doing so. A taxi ride would have cost about $24/rt if they don't wait for you. Overall, the staff was very accommodating. They did try to pressured us to attend an owner's update breakfast, but we just wanted to relax with our friends and enjoy the resort. The shuttle to the was a nice touch do to the hot weather, but on a good day you should be able to walk to the middle of strip and buy a $7 24 hour pass on the bus. It will take you up and down the strip all day long. We don't gamble so we come to Vegas to visit family, take in a show, and eat. If you are a couple, splurge a litte and stay at the Venetian and be spoiled for a price you can't even get a 2 star hotel in downtown Chicago or NYC. If you have kids and not interested in the gaming, stay at this beautiful 3star resort. The full kitchen affords an opportunity for you and your family to enjoy a meal or two together each day of your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay for our family of 5!”
Reviews.Author: gtwnmom3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nts in your 2 bedroom suite. It was beautiful and very comfortable. Didn't lack anything. Had a problem with the inroom safe and it was fixed right away with a followup courtesy call Which was nice. Games room was very nice and kids had fun. Loved that we could sign out new release DVDs,games etc for free. Our girls did a craft one day at the kids club - soapmaking. They had fun but alitle expensive. Being a family of 5 it was great to save on eating out and the fully equipped kitchen was great. Liked that we had an option for housekeeping and that we werent bothered by time share ppl after saying no once. All in all a great stay and we'd go again but some things that we didnt like too much were: the pool temperatures were all SOOOOO very cold! We Live in Texas and have the same temperatures and our pool water is very nice. Kids wouldn't swim in it and it created a lot of stress for us. Also being a family resort, they should add something to the pool (slide or something) to make it more fun. Also to get from one building to the next you have to walk outside thru the parking lot which was alittle odd. Location was a couple of blocks from strip behind and in between MGM grand and planet Hollywood. About 10-15 walk to the strip. My hubby and I took a cab one night to the strip $8 in front of Paris and walked back and t was great. We would stay again if we were to return and recommend this hotel. You can tell that they are really attentive, friendly and helpful. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “LAS VEGAS BABY”
Reviews.Author: wildcrazyatver
Reviews.Content: Wow what a trip this was and all the reviews you read were right on the head as we stayed at this resort July21-29 The suite we had was a 2br and very nice .the staff here are the best i've been to so far and thats saying alot.A large pool for people under 18 and another for the adults.This was a excelent spot as it was close to alot of attractions on the strip which was in walking distance.Las vegas is awsome and the temp while we were there was in the 100-110 degrees every day,hot but not to bad as there isnt any humidity. If you are thinking on going to Las Vegas think about this hotel as its a time share but you usually find deals on ebay

Reviews.Title: “Bring patience when you check-in at this beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: jpatlantatraveler
Reviews.Content: Here's the truth about the Wyndham Grand Desert...it's a beautiful property about a fifteen minute walk off the strip with three pools, beautifully appointed and maintained rooms and ample parking but don't stay here if you're looking for reliable internet and/or air-conditioning. Spent three days here with a 12 year old in tow. Loved the location because it gets you a bit beyond the madness of the Las Vegas strip but is close enough to walk or cab to there when it's time to really experience Vegas. The unit was perfectly cleaned and maintained. The kitchen was well-equipped for basic cooking needs. There were two flat-screen televisions...one in the living room, one in the bedroom. Bathroom was large. Master bedroom had a jacuzzi tub and its own vanity with sink. Bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows and a nice comforter. Pull out sofa bed was surprisingly comfortable. The bathroom towels could've been nicer. Towels provided at the pool were nicer than the room towels. Speaking of the pool...lounge chairs were super comfy. Pool was monitored by a security guard which was nice. Internet was totally unreliable. It was very difficult to connect and to maintain a connection. Once connected, the connection was annoyingly slow. Unacceptable to have weak internet in this day and age. As for the A/C...we were there three nights. The first night it didn't work. Room was over 80 degrees. Outside temps in Vegas were over 100 degrees each day. Maintenance was called a total of five times during our stay. They were in the room every day maintaining the A/C unit...once they were there twice in one day. Rooms are equipped with sensors that shut off the A/C when you're not in the room. The first day the staff tried to convince me that it was hot because we'd just gotten there and the room needed time to cool down. That just resulted in a very warm night for us since the A/C wasn' t working properly. We were not offered a room switch until well into day two of our three day stay. At that point the air was working and it would've been a hassle to move. Bottom line, the staff was nice about it and as responsive as possible, but after the third or fourth call they should've just moved us. Although I spent much of this review complaining about the A/C...the staff was genuinely kind and attentive about it and we weren't in the room that much during the day so it wasn't fatal. One other complaint, and I know it can't be avoided in a timeshare scenario, but I could've done without the sales pitch after fiver hours on the road and with a kid standing there wanting to get to the room! I'd stay here again, though, based on location, well-appointed units, swimming pools and the friendly attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an Oasis in the Desert -- just off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: rmsr163
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well maintained with 2 large pools. A short 5-minute walk to the strip, the hotel provided a peaceful alternative to the craziness and noise of the Strip. Great, friendly hotel staff greeted every request. Happy to make any arrangement or booking you needed. The room was a lovely decorated, spacious 1 bedroom, 1 large bath with a jacuzzi tub, and kitchen. After visiting other hotel's lobbies on the strip that are loud and crowded, the Wyndham was truly an 'oasis' in the desert. We would recommend 3 restaurants on or just off strip; 1) Mon Ami Gabi in Paris. Ask for an outside table where you dine while watching the Bellagio Fountains choreographed to music, 2) Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill was superb! and 3) TODAI Sushi Buffet - approx. $30pp. - better than any other buffet. We tried the Village Buffet and were terribly disappointed - mediocre and uninspired food.

Reviews.Title: “Family Resort in shadow of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: grggrr
Reviews.Content: Quiet family resort with three pools, just blocks from the heart of the Las Vegas Strip. Covered parking or shuttle service available

Reviews.Title: “Great family place to stay in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Brejaxmum
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here on our most recent trip to Vegas. When it's just Hubby and I we stay on the strip but we didn't want to do that with our kids along, plus I wanted a kitchen to have the option of eating in. We used Wyndham points to get a beautiful 2 bedroom suite, 2 baths and a kitchen. It was lovely. We looked out onto the pool area, which the kids used despite the chilly weather! We were still close enough that we could walk to the strip, the hotel is easy to get and out of, they have a games room (again, the kids made use of this to rent free movies and play video games) and we really appreciated having the room to stretch out and relax. We ate breakfast and a few dinners in the suite so we saved some money there. as well. Oh, a bonus is that the beds are VERY comfy!! Over all we were extremely happy with our stay at the Grand Desert and will stay there again when we take our kids back!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: AAM17
Reviews.Content: I would defently recommened this hotel. Very clean, roomy , and EVERYONE was so friendly especally the bell hops, and security guards. ! :) I had a great stay , and hope to return some day !

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Thaibunny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Grand Desert with my family because my mother has a timeshare with Wyndham. I've stayed here multiple times, without any complaints and usually enjoy my stay. The Grand Desert Resort is a nice place for families to stay in Vegas, away from the hustle and bustle of The Strip, but just a 10 minute walk or 5 min shuttle to the main attractions. Check-in was no problem, it was quick and easy and our guests who arrived before us were able to check in without the vacation owner being present. That being said, the last time we stayed here there was a little mix up with our room...our guests who checked in before us went up to our assigned room to find a room that was a sweltering 80 degrees. This is at 9pm. When our party arrived later around 11pm, the thermostat still read 80 degrees, so we called a technician to come and take a look. Within 15 minutes or so, two men came to look at what was wrong, and promptly told us that the A/C would need to be serviced and we would be moving to another room shortly. After thanking them, we proceeded to wait for a bellhop to come with new keys and a luggage cart to escort us to a new room. There we waited for over an hour in the hot room, until finally we heard a knock which was the bellhop. We were then escorted to our room, and after a little complaining from my mother the vacation owner, the bellhop promised to return to our room with complimentary champagne and chocolate as a means of apologizing for the inconvenience. My girlfriend and I had gone down to the pool for a bit and decided to go back to the room to shower and freshen up. Since we had our do not disturb sign on the door, we got skipped when housekeeping came along in the morning, so I made a call down to front desk to have someone come and replenish our shampoo/conditioner/lotion etc., supply. There we sat, in our wet bikinis, thinking that there would be someone knocking on the door any minute with our requested items...this also took over an hour. We called down to front desk to make sure that they didn't forget about us, and were assured that someone would be there soon. Finally someone came with a timid knock and brought handfuls of wonderful soap and cleaning things. For them taking so long in the actual delivery of the goods, they are certainly quick in customer service response because not 5 minutes after we got our toiletries, we got a call from front desk confirming that we had received our requested items. Other than those two incidents, our stay here was great and we enjoyed the quiet facilities. Rooms are clean and very spacious compared to what you'd get on the strip for the same price, if not more. What I love about it is that each room has a fully equipped kitchen and a full size refrigerator, so if you want to bring your own food and cook you can without having to bring all your pots and pans and plates and such. Its nice because you don't walk into the hotel or any of the rooms with that stale old smoke smell, since it is a smoke free resort. The furnishings are a little outdated, but everything is still very nice and clean and well-kept. They even have True Blue Spa toiletries in all the bathrooms which is definitely a plus. The resort did have a full gym, which I will probably try to take advantage of next time I stay. Overall I would definitely stay here again, but be warned that service may be a little slow.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was gorgeous.”
Reviews.Author: Vkboles
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare hotel and the rooms are huge and fully stocked. They were amazingly clean and just blocks off the strip. They had several pools, one for just adults and one for families. It soirée everyone's needs. I was so impressed!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great unit and great pools”
Reviews.Author: ira34473
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to the Wyndham Grand Desert and we can't wait to go back. We had a one bedroom unit with a full kitchen, dining and living room. Our one week vacation was terriffic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Time in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jennifer1108
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas over Valentines day for the annual USA 7's Rugby Tournament. We stayed at the Wyndham Grand Desert as I own timeshare through Wyndham. We rented a car and I'm glad we did- Wyndham is off of the strip not far from the Hard Rock. We found it easy to navigate to all the places we wanted to go. Each hotel offers parking for free so we took advantage of it. The unit was very nice, well equipped and comfortable. Wyndham has the most comfortable beds! Everyone was very friendly at the resort and willing to help us if we needed directions or had any questions. We attended a timeshare "update" which seemed to drag on but since I'm already an owner it wasn't pressured. We did receive a $50 credit for a restaurant. We went to Mesa Grill in Cesar's on Valentines- it was excellent. It is pricey but worth the splurge for a special occasion! We used the hot tub and the pool at the resort- both were very clean and nice. We were able to get free WI-FI in our room - we just called the front desk and asked if we could get a complementary code to use while we were staying there. All we had to do was ask and we didn't have to pay the $30ish charge for it. Would stay there again- and recommend it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Immortalgr81
Reviews.Content: We got to the resort and the front desk check in process was easy and welcoming, he offered options to views and was acommidating, i asked for a luggage cart and was offered a bell guy to take everything out of my trunk and directly into my room. The activitied room is east to find and has a veriety of options of games, the pool is great, big and with a towel section for alll your drying needs, plenty of chairs, they have a huge kids pool and plenty of jet tubs. Parking is plentiful and great spots to avoid the sun all over. Free crib rental, set of towels and more blankets available just a call away. The check out process is even easier, call the bell desk, tell then you're ready to vacate the room and you're all set. I love every bit of this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but too far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: jbo_11
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay on Sun. 6/12-Thurs. 6/17. We have stayed in Wyndhams before through time shares & the resort was nice & clean. The kitchen is nice, only used it for breakfast because we were out on the town the rest of the time. The shuttles were nice to Harrah's, but I'm still puzzled by the times & late night pick-ups only at Rio, which is not by Harrah's & not convenient at all if you are on the strip til midnight, which we were most nights! (I had my pedometer & we walked an average of 6-7 miles each day, which included taking the shuttle to Harrah's each morning & doing shopping/casinos/shows each day until about midnight. We walked back to the hotel each night, granted we could have paid a cab, but figured the walking would do us good!) My recommendation is to add shuttles from Harrah's back to Wyndham until at least 12 or 1 a.m. We enjoyed the adult pool, as we went with another couple & left the kiddos at home, so it was nice not to have kids being loud in the pool! We did the Pool party 1 day & it was nice to get a good deal on drinks at the resort. Also, a couple observations/tips, skip the $4 charge pp for grocery shopping to Von Ric's & walk to CVS by Hard Rock Hotel (or there's a Walgreens on the strip or they have groceries in the main Tower, but probably $1 more on most things at CVS.) Groceries are not cheap, but is anything in Vegas?? (At CVS, eggs $3.89 dozen, cereal about $4 box, 1/2 gallon milk $3 something, bread $3.69.) We wanted groceries for breakfast the next morning, so we didn't want to wait until the next day. We thought about going to Fremont Street, but never made it, but noticed that it was $15 pp to take you there f/ 5-9 p.m. through Wyndham. Not sure if this included anything (the neon sign museum?) because we didn't check into the details, we changed our mind on going downtown, but you can take the bus from the strip much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded every expectation!”
Reviews.Author: genmgr01
Reviews.Content: As it's typically a vacation rental / timeshare, I wasn't sure what to expect. What we found upon arrival was a beautiful resort that was better than I could have asked for! The buildings feel brand new, as does the luxurious pool area. The rooms were spotless, and it was so nice to have a full kitchen and washer / dryer. We were able to have an inexpensive breakfast of cereal and juice each morning, which is a huge savings. By our fourth night, we were "Vegased out" and decided to have a pizza delivered and just relax in the huge living room by the gas fireplace. It is so nice to have that option! Toiletries, etc. were of the same quality one would find in any nice hotel, and even included a soothing lotion for sunburns. That was a nice touch I hadn't seen elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “BIG ROOMS, BUT OFF THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: PurviDadia
Reviews.Content: The stay was comfortable, we had booked 3 rooms, we were in a suite, with kitchenette fully equipped, living room and then bedroom, we had a jacuzzi to ourselves, washing machine, dryer etc...it was a comfortable stay, however, it s off the strip, but its not far away. The decor is very jaded, they need to renovate. overall a good option.

Reviews.Title: “first trip to vegas”
Reviews.Author: rdf212
Reviews.Content: I went with with 5 other people, and we stayed in a deluxe two bedroom suite on the 13th floor of Tower 3. I loved the hotel, and our room was great. We had the room booked from May 29th - June 5th. We had 4 people of our group come May 29th, 1 person came on May 30th, and 1 person came on June 1st. 3 people left on June 3rd, 1 person left June 4th, and 2 people left June 5th. The hotel had no absolutely no problem with us having people coming and going into the hotel/room different days, which was nice. The woman helping us check-in was very helpful, and told us the different types of rooms we could choose from. She showed us on a map which rooms were available, what had the best view, what she thought was the nicest room, etc. I also asked the customer service desk a few questions, and they were all extremely helpful as well. I liked having the 24 hour pool and hot tub in Tower 3, it was really nice to go down there when we go home for the night and having it just outside the doors. There were always tons of seats around the pools available. The adults only pool was not in the sun until around noon most days we were there, so we would start at the family pool at move over in the afternoon. The group I was with went for my 21st birthday, which was mentioned at the front desk, and they delivered champagne and chocolates to the room, as well as a card, which I thought was very nice of them. There is a shuttle that leaves the hotel starting around 8am going to Harrah's on the strip. We used the shuttle a lot the week we were there. It usually came around the :15 and :45 parts of the hour, and left harrah's at the :00 and :30 parts of the hour. We would usually get on the shuttle infront of Tower 2, and get dropped off at Tower 3. It was nice to be off of the strip because it's not as loud, and so it was nice at night because it was peaceful when we ended the day in the hot tub. But our room also had a great view of the strip, which was amazing at night. For the room, the beds were comfortable, air conditioner works, had a jacuzzi tub, ice machine, etc. But because it was a time share room, we did not have a maid every day. If we wanted a maid, we had to pay extra. We could get towels and stuff anytime we wanted though. So we just cleaned up after ourselves. There is also a Starbucks cart in the Tower 2 lobby, which is great. And there is a cafe in Tower 1 that has amazing food, especially their cheese sticks, and they also deliver room service to your room if you want. There is no casino in the hotel, but there is a pretty small bar, and they have some slot machines to play. On a side note about Vegas in general, we went to see LOVE, the Beatles Cirque show, and it was absolutely amazing. I am not a big Beatles fan, but I thought the show was so great. And the gift shop there has pretty much everything you could want. Also, we got 2-for-1 coupons from the Vegas.com book (there are so many coupon books around the lobby in Tower 2, specially at the customer service booth) to go up the Eiffel Tower at the Paris hotel. So it was $11 for 2 people to go to the top, and I recommend doing that to anyone who is not afraid of heights. The view of the strip is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient if you are visiting Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RayBro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from March27th to April 2nd. We had a very enjoyable stay. The shuttle to the strip was very convenient. Side trips to Hoover Dam, Red Rock were also easy from here. If you are planning a visit make sure you understand the difference between the standard and deluxe room. You will also be asked to attend an owners or sales session.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service. Noisy rooms and no refunds or changes to your reservations. Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: Vivieyra
Reviews.Content: Terrible customer service. This is a time share so the front desk people are not aware of the rates or cannot do ANY changes for you since the way to book it is through Wyndam. Beware that when you do a reservation you will be charged to your card automatically and there are NO refunds even if you want to leave early. I am really desappointed of this chain and will never stay in a Wyndam again. The rooms are ok however they are noisy, the air conditioning unit is loud and I can hear the people next door. The location is bad and for the same money we could have stayed in a better hotel. The sheets of the bed are smelly and the furniture is very uncomfortable. I travel a lot during the year (4 months out of the year) and this is my first and last stay at a Wyndam.

Reviews.Title: “The resort and units are nice but the customer service is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Jolimbo
Reviews.Content: This resort is located less than a mile off the strip. The resort and the individual units are nice but the furniture is very uncomfortable. I would not stay here again because their customer service is terrible. Here is what we experienced: A week before arrival I requested both of our units on the same floor and was assured that this would be provided. I called again that morning to confirm this since we would be arriving late at night, and I was again assured that they were holding two units for us on the same floor. When we arrived we were told they didn't even have two units in the same builiding. Finally after speaking to the manager she said they were cleaning a unit in the same builiding as one of our units and if we were willing to wait 45 minutes they would bring the keys to us in our unit that was already available in that buillding. We agreed, although it was after midnight and we'd been traveling all day because even though it still wouldn't be on the same floor at least it would be in the same building. After waiting an hour and a half I called down to the desk inquiring about our second unit and was told the manager had gone home. The manager that had come on duty didn't know anything about the fact that we were still waiting for our second unit. By this time it was almost 2:00 in the morning. The bellman was very rude. When I reported this to the head bellman he did nothing. The concierge was rude and useless. When I said we were looking for a recommendation for a restaurant, his response was "there's about 2000 of them". When I pursued a recommendation, he just indicated all the restaurants in the immediate area around the hotel. We were on a limitied budget and some of our group were not 21 so we had planned to spend most of our days relaxing and reading at the pool. However, they played somewhat loud and extreming annoying 20 year old rock music at the pool all day and eventing. When I asked the lifeguard if they played this all the time, his response was "yeah, why is there a problem?". When I explained that it was annoying to have to listen to this music all day and evening long". Instead of changing the music to something that would appeal to everyone, or turning it down a little, he said people requested music and left it at that. I noticed he was the only one bopping around to it. Everyone in our group was annoyed by it and we had people ranging in age from their teens, twenties and into the 50s. Finally after 4 days, that lifeguard went off duty and they changed the music to something that was palatable to everyone and turned the volume down. We were finally able to read by the pool and enjoy it in relative peace for our last two days. It's a shame that the preferences of one lifeguard robbed us of a peaceful, relaxing time at the pool for most of our stay. There was not one comfortable seat in the living area and the beds could be better. Also there was only enough seating for 4 in the living area even though the unit is rated for 8 people, and there was enough room for at least one more chair.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WithMJT
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, beautiful grounds. Our room was wonderful. The only trouble we had was with our key cards. They may or may not work the elevator, but then would work the room door fine or not work at all or work both. Off the strip a bit and no casino made it nice for us. It is nice to get away from all of that at the end of the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cjones96
Reviews.Content: The resort was wonderful - stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with another couple and we both felt there was lots of privacy as the bedrooms were on opposite ends of the suite. It was nice to share accomodations from the social aspect (having drinks together etc..) but it was also nice to feel like you had your privacy. The strip was a short walk away but you could take a free shuttle if you wanted. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The pool area was very nice and a great set up - one pool for adults and one for kids. I would highly recommend this resort as a place to stay for couples or families if you don't mind being a little bit off the strip.It was actually nice to get to experience both the glamour of the strip and then the peacefulness of the resort - it was like 2 vacations in one!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Wyndham Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah253
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Wyndham owners but we do not own at Grand Desert. This was our first visit to the Grand Desert with our two young sons (ages 10 and 6). We checked in late at night and check in was speedy. Our room was in Tower 3, a very short walk from the main lobby in Tower 2. Our room was very lovely and clean and a welcomed site after a long day of travelling. We did attend the "owners' update" breakfast one morning. Yes, they do try to sell you more points but the rep we met with was great. I learned more about my ownership with Wyndham in the 2 hours we were with him than I did over the years I've owned with Wyndham. At the end of 2 hours, I explained that we just could not financially swing the additional points purchase and Justin, our rep, was very understanding and very polite about turning down his offer. I was expecting an attitude from him but we never got it. He was extremely professional the whole time. We received our two $25 restaurant vouchers and were on our way. We used the vouchers at the buffet at Harras and only had to pay in $6 (family of 4 came to $56 for lunch). So I was glad I did get the vouchers. My only complaint about the resort had to do with the hot tubs by the pools. The pool by Tower 3 is 24 hours. The water was not warm and the resort seems to be quite windy (how weird is that). So it felt too cool to swim there. The hot tub by that pool was closed all week for maintenance but I never saw anyone working on it. There are two hot tubs by the main pool and one of them had a lot of dirt in it the whole week so I know nobody was cleaning it. Also the jets in that tub didn't seem to work. That means there was only 1 properly working and clean hot tub by the pools accessable to families. The pool water itself was cooler than I would have liked but I'm guessing as time goes by and the weather heats up, the pools will warm up. I did sleep pretty well at night. The beds are very comfy but I still woke up with a stiff back. I really like the fact that the resort is not on the strip. I don't really care for the party atmosphere at the strip hotels nor the crowds. Wyndham offers a free shuttle from the resort to Harrah's which we used several times. The full working kitchen in our unit (2 bedroom deluxe) makes it easy to prepare meals so it helped save us $$. The jacuzzi tub in the master bathroom is great on the back, legs and feet after a long day of walking. I highly recommend Wyndham Grand Desert for everyone but most especially for families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL RESORT AT A GREAT PRICE”
Reviews.Author: altzma
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW, what a great place. I stayed with a few friends as we wanted to get together, cook a meal and stay in a nice place near a popular casino. The check in team was wonderful, responsive and courteous. The Resort Host was equally responsive and professional. The room was beautiful, modern and in perfect condition. The jetted tub, bath and body amenities and lovely furnishings were great. The pool was amazing and huge fire pit and sitting area was perfect for hanging out with a drink on a chilly night. I could go on and on but would recommend it to everyone. Don't forget there is a full kitchen, dishes, iron, etc. so it's very convenient. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: D-Klickitat
Reviews.Content: I took my mother and sister to Vegas for their first time. We stayed here as I have own timeshare points with Wyndam. The resort is very nice. We didnt spend much time at the resort but we had a 1 bedroom suite. We had a full mini kitchen & washer and dryer. Check in was simple and easy. Housekeeping was very accommodating. When we would call down for extra towels or anything the were prompt in delivery. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. We only stayed 4 nights so there for did not have any housekeeping in our room. Had plenty of dirty towels by the end of our stay so a laundry shoot for those would have been a good thing. We took the shuttle a lot. My mom is in a wheel chair and the busses had lifts. We had one driver Bob who was our favorite and made us feel right at home. Used the pool and hot tubs (open 24 hours) they were clean and warm. The resort is quiet also. We never heard a thing during the night time hours. I highly recommend this resort to all.

Reviews.Title: “spacious rooms, lots for kids,but.....”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel60750
Reviews.Content: only HOT water on washer worked so would shut off at rinse cycle and had to watch what you washed in it. Staff very pushy about attending there membership update, even after I told 2 different people I was not interested in attending they called my room and tried to guilt me into attending. They say they have "movies by the pool" as one of their activies but its really "movies in the grass behind the pool". Was clean, quiet, and easy parking.

Reviews.Title: “Families, groups and the lone stranger. Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Continuous_Explorer
Reviews.Content: I have recently just returned from my stay at the Wyndham Grand Desert for 4 nights. I was in a one bedroom suite with a strip view, facing North. The room was large, walkig into the room, I had the bathroom with large full wall sized mirror and counter with shorter tub (still great for soking your feet after waling the strip) and a hallway closet and hidden full size washer and dryer. The kitchen was stocked with all amenties needed, I did no cooking while on my stay. A large living room with dinning table for 4 and couch. The room was clean and I even felt clean walking around in bare feet, as I never do in hotel rooms. There are 3 buildings, the first two surrounding the 1 main pool, 1 adults only pool and 3 hot tubs. different terrace levels break up the pool level very nicely. Life guards on duty and late pool hours in effect. The resort has no casino and so it feels more like a hotel than the other resorts on the strip. The walk from front lobby takes less than15 minutes to reach the strip coming up near Planet Hollywood and the Harley Davidson Restaurant. A free shuttle to and from the strip is offered running every 20-30 minutes depending on traffic. Drop off is at the Harrahs Casino. I had a chance to view a 3 bedroom unit. Very spacious. This would be a wonderful place for a family to stay. Pools, fulll kitchen, free shuttle, internet access, game room and daily activities available. Including: Tie Die shirt making, waffle breakfast, billards, and more, new activites every week. The location of the hotel is less than a 10mintes walk, East, to access to all of the following: Hard Rock Hotel and Casino, Liquor store, Subway, CVS, Johnny Rockets and my new favorite sandwich place, Capriotti's. I would reccommend Families first and those wishing to have a taste of the Las Vegas "Strip Scene" but still wanting to enjoy more of Las Vegas attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to get off the strip”
Reviews.Author: sjbert
Reviews.Content: First time here. Found the Hotel to be nice, safe, quiet. If you are looking for the glitz and lights of the strip, dont bother coming here. The rooms were nice, clean, and well apointed. My biggest complaint about the facility was that there were no handles on any of the kitchen cupboards. I have an issue with my fingertips, and found this to be a constant irritant. Asked a few people at the desks, and was given an answer of "I have no idea why". Given the cost, I would think they could finish off these details by now. Other than James O. at the front desk,, who did not seem to believe that our keys had stopped working, and rolling his eyes at us, all staff were friendly, and most anxious to help. Nice having an in room washer and dryer, as well as microwave, blender, etc. Would recommend this place in a minute

Reviews.Title: “When they say they do a different Timeshare Presentation; THEY DO!!!”
Reviews.Author: motorcitymike53
Reviews.Content: Drove the 4 hour trek from Southern California to Wyndham Grand Dessert. Check in was smooth; the front dest made certain that our friends would have a room nearby without hesitation. That was the first indication that property would be exceptional. Before going to your room, you are asked to drop by the "Welcome Desk". Wyndham should be proud of the friendly, professionall staff which included Amber, Monica and their boss Shannon. We were given a nice greeting gift and plently of 2 for 1 coupons and almost free show vouchers. Amber invited us to an "owners revue", which we were reluctant to attend based on other Timeshare presentations. (The last 45 minute "revue" we went to lasted over 2 hours with not the best experience from the salesperson as we left) The next day the presentation was outstanding. After a "quicky" breakfast, our representative Ray was courteous and to the point. He took the time to explain in detail the benifits of upgrading to the various VIP levels and made sure we were aware of how to use all aspects of the programs. In a very short time ( I know you don't beleive me) we were on our way; gift in hand as promised. ( The gift, a dinner voucher for two, rang up as $84 + and was no charge at the restaurant) This resort seems to beleive that there as much benifit to reviewing the program in detail with owners,(so they will use it more); as there is to the high pressure; noisy room, bring in the closer tactics that we all are familar with. Hats off to Wyndham Grand Desert!!! We stayed in a one bedroom lockoff which is clean but small. The bathroom is down a hall in the room, which seemed like a mile during the night. The pools, sauna and workout center are top notch. Parking is around or under the the building and is good. There is a shuttle that runs to Harrahs in the heart of the strip. You can walk to Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile Shops but parts of the street is dark and littered with adult advertisments. In closing; it truly looks like this Timeshare has a different, friendlier plan to promote Wyndham. From the parking valets to the front desk everyone is outstanding. ,

Reviews.Title: “What a grand stay!”
Reviews.Author: southam97
Reviews.Content: Its a perfect balance of Strip and a relaxing, rejuvenating moment. The facilities, heated outdoor pools, hot tubs and small snack bar, combined with the gym and spa, while within walking distance to the strip or the very convenient shuttle bus, gives plenty of options for Strip life or unwinding

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place near The Strip”
Reviews.Author: wesbw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wyndham Grand Desert from Feb. 19 to 26 and the experience was wonderful! The staff were very friendly, and my 2-bedroom condo on the 7th floor of the main building was spacious, clean, and comfortable. I didn't have any problem with people making too much noise. The other guests that I encontered were very well behaved and friendly people (lots of families, no obnoxious drunks). I was able to sleep comfortably without interruption. I was never even bothered by phone calls from the staff. My windows looked out on the north section of the strip. I could see most of the hotels from Planet Hollywood all the way to The Stratosphere. The grounds were very nice, though I really didn't use many of the amenities. I used the fitness center once, and the computer room once. Both were more than adequate. Both of these places can, however, get crowded at times. The walk to the strip is a bit long, but fine if you're an avid walker. It took me 10 minutes, but for most people it would probably take 15. I didn't use the free shuttle since I had a car. However, it saw it picking up people frequently. I purchased the internet wifi for the week at $30. I never had a problem getting connected. However, sometimes the connection was a little slow. When I tried doing a video call, that didn't work out too well. For all other purposes, the connection was fine. This really is a good quality place if you don't mind staying a bit off the strip. I would certainly stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone, especially families.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you want to get any sleep”
Reviews.Author: Rosie1118035
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for 1 week now and it is very noisy and we have had very little sleep with people comming in at 4.00 a.m. making a lot of noise and using their hot tubs, swearing, slamming doors etc. This is not a place to stay at unless you intend staying up all night. However it is clean and convenient for the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent”
Reviews.Author: jondavi
Reviews.Content: No hot water for the entire 6 day stay. Had a package delivered overnight by UPS,took them 2 hours to find it after the receiving person signed for it. Glad RCI is no longer involved with them.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: AARC
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare resort, and we had that in mind. We had a fantastically nice stay at the Desert Rose down the street, which is smaller- so we expected this resort to be nicer. When we arrived, our reservation was canceled. The person checking us in was not very welcoming and did not explain why it was canceled. He left and returned, told us it was taken care of, but we had already started to panic, especially while waiting for him to return. We disliked that we were sent to another place to then receive our information about the hotel and then an attempt for a time share sales meeting was also pitched. We were already drained from the drive and upset about our reservation being canceled. We already own a time share, hence using the points to go there, and the invite for the time share meeting was interestingly unclear so that guests wouldn't realize what they were in for. I don't think that that's a good or right tactic. They tell you it's breakfast or lunch and that you'll get a package/gift, but don't tell you that it's about membership or how long it will take (plan on 4 hours for any timeshare pitch). We also were surprised by the $65 cleaning fee, which makes absolutely no sense. Not only did I pay $75 to transfer the points to stay there, but now we were being hit with another $65 fee that I was completely uninformed about when making the reservation. I'm sorry, but cleaning is an expectation of staying anywhere- any hotel, motel, or time share. It's a part of what the membership is already paying for, and we found that quite annoying, illogical, and wrong. We expected the Wyndham to be nicer than it was, frankly. The room looked nice, but things were just a little off. The quality behind it wasn't there. Things were slightly askew or dirty/old. The room we were put in was a disabled room, and my husband and I were somewhat put off by the design and features of the bathroom. The shower was meant for a wheelchair, so the water floods the bathroom. The doors to the bathroom are sliding doors and difficult to open and close normally. It just seemed like we were in the wrong room and the wrong place for a romantic weekend away. The hallway STUNK. There were about 4 different smells that made me queasy each time we left the room. Made me wonder what happened in the hallway. There was a mix of bleach, pumped in smell, and soap. Each turn was a new experience of masked smells, one on top of the other. It would be a nice place for people from the midwest and snowbirds. Families would enjoy it, but there are other places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again.......”
Reviews.Author: reesecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Thurs to Fri, through Super Bowl weekend. Having spent last year on the strip, we were wondering if we might feel like we were missing something by not staying there again, but that was not the case. Having a rental car made a big difference for us and I recommend getting one if staying here. Parking is easy at all of the strip hotels and casinos and it made it easier for us to come and go as we pleased without waiting on the Wyndham shuttle that stops only at Harrah's, and doesn't run after 10:00pm. Having a washer/dryer in our unit allowed us to pack lighter. We had plenty of space and it was peaceful - a much welcomed quiet after spending all day and night on the strip and/or down at Fremont Street. Very comfortable accomodations and really nice grounds with outdoor pools and spas. And surprisingly, the only time we were strong-armed by the pushy sales staff was when we were visiting the other hotels/casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: ludwick2002
Reviews.Content: My husband, 23 year old daughter, and I spent a week here in January. One major disappointment was that the main pool closed a few days after we checked in without any warning ahead of time...it closed for complete renovation. Although the unit is a nice size,the couch definitely needed replacing...all pillows completely sagged in...very worn. We were disappointed not to have free wifi in the rooms.....most other time shares we check into and the one we own in Orlando have wifi provided. We were also dissatisfied with the courtesy of one gentleman in particular. One evening champagne was provided in the lobby; I took a small glass for my daughter and myself. We did not have our purses with us, and had never thought of not having proof of age. One gentleman, clearly on a power trip but doing his job, came up to my daughter (who looks older than her age) and asked for id; I told him that she was 23; he asked her year of birth, and I unfortunately answered 87; too bad...he then proceeded to tell me that he had wanted her to answer to see if she could come up with the correct year quickly...which I did. It was his rude way of actually making a scene instead of being discreet. The major problem at this hotel are the time share salesmen. After we were kind of tricked into going to a presentation......the lady at checkin said they wanted to provide us breakfast for giving them some feedback about the property---we were hit with insultive hard sell tactics. The gentleman even questioned our intelligence (!!) for not buying more timeshare. I would recommend NOT attending this presentation no matter what incentive they offer you. Jeff, our salesman, was so condescending and kept repeating himself over and over instead of accepting the fact that we had said, "No, not interested in buy another timeshare." The location is good; the shuttle to Harrahs is a definite bonus. The units have everything in them that you coulod possibly need.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Service with a Smile and the Extra Mile--for a bachlorette weekend”
Reviews.Author: jrpetri
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Vegas. I can not recommend this place enough. It was wonderful. The manager Jaime was extremely helpful. We originally had a presidential suite with two large bedrooms, but since we had a pregnant friend and 6 women total I felt a little cramped with the layout of the room. When we returned to the front desk, I was asked about my satisfaction with the room. I immediately said that our previous stays had much larger accommodations. Immediately without hesitation, Jaime (pronounced Hi-may), let us view another option. We were downgrading to a much larger suite with less up to date furnishings. The furnishings were slightly out of date, meaning there were only two flat screens and one normal T.V. Also, the kitchen wasn't as sexy as the initial room. BUT it was so much more spacious. We had an amazing view of the strip and so much room that we didn't know what to do with it! Whenever we needed anything, I mean anything, the staff was so incredibly helpful! I had a female emergency, and the staff at the concierge desk ran all over to find me feminine napkins, FOR FREE!!! (Embarrassing as that story is, I know that it indicates how diligent the staffers are in this resort. This is a fabulous place with lots of fun within a few blocks. But, a lot of Vegas is spread out, and unless you like walking in heels, which I do not, you will need to use a car service. I highly recommend renting a car, although they have free limo service/shuttles every so often. You just have to tip well. The cabs are unreal and the drivers are terrible, so DEFINITELY rent a car or use limos. The room next to ours was a bit loud at various times, but I'm sure with a quick phone call they would have been told to quiet down. The pools and spas are numerous and there are plenty of convenience stores for quick snacks, souvenirs, and small meals. We loved this place and its staff so much!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveBoi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 32 year old son stayed for a week and we really enjoyed ourselves. The staff, our room and the facilities exceeded our expectations. We made good use of the fitness center and the outside hot tubs. Took advantage of several things the activities center had to offer including a $3 return trip to a grocery store, a Texas Hold Em tournament with other resort guests, and free internet in the business centre. It's about a 2 block walk to the strip. A few times we took the resort's shuttle bus to the Harrah's on the strip - never had to wait very long. We saw the Cirque show "O" at the Bellagio and it was fantastic. Also took a bus trip to the Grand Canyon through Vision - a long day but well worth it. Check out the Haufbrauhaus German beer garden which is just one block or so east of the resort. The weather was cool most of the time we were there, but it didn't stop us from having a great time.

Reviews.Title: “customer service not a Wyndham priority”
Reviews.Author: pa_uthe
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the Grand Desert on the day of our 35th wedding anniversary in a 2 bedroom presidential suite. despite having told Wyndham management about our special day there was no aknowledgement whatsoever. The suite was clean but furnishings were tired and overall not much better than a standard suite With one exception, the staff seemed to be just going through the motions and could not care less about concerns particularly after we said we would not be increasing our timeshare holdings. Wyndham always disappoints but for some perverse reason we keep going back; maybe this time we will have learned our lesson.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: eltellez
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that my family does own timeshares with Wyndham but trust me when I say that I haven't been fairly pleased with the company itself. Our stay their was pleasant! We were a part of 5 that included two college students and a young child. Personally enjoyed the fact that we were not on the strip it allowed for a quieter atmosphere at the hotel. Grand Desert is very much a family oriented hotel if I had to say anything about which worked wonderfully for our family. The shuttle allowed us to have quick access to the strip and be part of the action without the walk but even then the hotel was not very far from the strip. The hotel is also located near the Hard Rock cafe (we spent a fair amount of time there) and 2 blocks from the strip. The only problem we really encountered was a leak in the master bedroom. Sometime the hotel management addressed right away. My only warning is this...Wyndham is VERY pushy with its sales I suggest you try to avoid it at all costs. Unless you're considering a timeshare it really becomes aggravating when they start negotiating with you about their timeshares. Of course we've had a rather horrid experience with the management of sales at several stays in different parts of the country but over all (without much involvement from their people) we've managed to enjoy it thus far.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Allinclusiveguy1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Grand Desert and were not disappointed. It was my fifth time there and my wife's first time. I thought all the amenities were great, the decorations for Christmas and the holiday season were exceptional and the staff were welcoming. If you are looking for a hotel without the hussle and bussle of a strip hotel, then this is the place for you. It is quiet, has no loud or obnoxious activities going on 24/7. There is no restaurants or casinos on site. They provide free shuttle service that runs every 20-30 minutes to Harrah's in the heart of the strip. The hotel has two huge heated pools and the rooms are like little apartments with every amenity you can imagine. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking to be able to go back to their room and escape the busy strip and have peace and quiet. If you are looking for non stop action and 24/7 entertainment, casinos, restaurants, shops, etc. then this is not the place to stay. Everything is within walking distance though if you crave that and you can stay here for a fraction of the price that you would pay on the strip for MGM Grand, The Hrad Rock or Planet Hollywood (all within a few blocks from this resort).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Quiet Stay, Close Enough to the Action”
Reviews.Author: LivandMarc
Reviews.Content: I will preface this with we are Wyndham owners - however, we do not own in Vegas. This was our 4th trip to Vegas and second stay at the Grand Desert. The property itself is very nice - since our last visit they have added some video poker and video type slot machines. We stayed 12/4 - 12/7/2010 so we were there for the LV Marathon and NBR event so there were significantly more people on property than I remember from our vist 3 years ago, however, the crowds were really only prevelant in the lobby, in the evening. Check in was a breeze, but I was disappointed that I couldn't get a strip view room. We did have a nice view of the pool/courtyard area, which is lit up beautifully at night. As is usual after check in we were shuffled accross the lobby to pick up our parking pass - which is code for - try to con you into a sales pitch. I've been through this a million times before, and though I tried repeatedly to say no - it seems the least I could get away with was agreeing to a survey the next day in our room. They did stick to the survey agenda and she was out of our room in 20-30 minutes. We got our gift card, which we used in Vegas without issue. It was a little cold to use the pool, but we did walk around the pool deck, play with the large chess set and enjoy some time sitting by the fire pit. The location is great - within walking distance to HRH, two blocks off the strip with shuttle service to and from the strip. (We've walked it, it's doable - but the shuttle is much quicker.) We had a one bedroom unit - clean - everything was on site where it should've been, appliances worked well. Bed was not comfortable - which is abnormal for a Wyndham property - I could hardly sleep while I was there. Overall, the resort was in excellent condition - the same as if not better than it was on our previous trip. Staff is friendly and always provides service with a smile. Starbucks cart on site = huge plus! Convenience store, nice to have but $$$$ of course. Sandwich/Pizza shop was nice, but food wasn't anything to write home about. Wi-fi did not work well on the 9th floor. All in all, it's always a pleasant stay. It's nice to be off the strip but within quick and easy access to MGM, PH, HRH, Harrah's, etc. Will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lv marathon stay”
Reviews.Author: Foghornd
Reviews.Content: Resort showed great improvement since my last stay 2 yrs ago. Very clean, staff friendly, good security. Only thing lacking was ride to start line.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MossiDivo
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time at the Wyndham Grand Desert. The hotel has three towers, we stayed in the tower that is removed from the two main towers that form the courtyard in the center with the two main pools. We liked this tower as it was further away from the crowds and families with younger children and therefore seemed quieter. Our room faced north towards the north strip and the mtns. beyond, a great view, especially at night. The two room suite was very comfortable and the one bedroom had a great jacuzzi tub. The rooms were clean and comfortable, as were the beds. The decor was not my tasted through the whole hotel, as it skewed a little on the retirement home side of the decor world. There was always someone cleaning or polishing something at all hours of the day, and all staff seemed kind and friendly. Pools were fine, there were I think three in all. Also, in terms of the people that are trying to sell you more timeshare stuff, its really not too bad. When you check in and get your keys you then go and talk to those people to set up a meeting with them. They are very flexible, and we had someone come up to the room and they brought bagels, cream cheese and coffee and juice and talked to us then. You can go and meet them in their office too. All in all, a very nice experience to have in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you dont want to stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Breezey
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas yearly for a trade show. We normally stay on the Strip to be close to the convention center but having a week of time share left over, we decided to trade. The real question here before booking is what you want out of your stay in Vegas. I love staying on the strip and walking from hotel to hotel. This Wyndham is off the main drag and while a couple of blocks from the MGM and Miracle Mile it is not in a great location. The shuttle bus is a nice touch but just didnt feel the Vegas mood staying there.
