Having said that, check in staff were terrific, the place is very clean (have no idea where that previous bed bug review came from, ridiculous) and we appreciated that we were not bothered even once with a time share sell as we told them at check in that we were there for business. We had a large one bedroom deluxe and while the granite counters in the kitchen and bathroom were nice and we appreciated having the large living room and bathroom space, there is a lot that can be learned from luxury hotels. Upgrade the linens. Buy some duvet covers rather than a top and bottom sheet that barely covers the duvets that I am pretty sure are not cleaned in between guests. Flat screen TV in living room is nice, why not have them in the bedrooms too. Kitchen is well stocked but upon arriving, while there had been an inventory checked, we had no coffee pot! That was immediately resolved, once again to great customer service. But why not also have a tea kettle for those who prefer tea and not by boiling water in a microwave. And please, free WiFi!!! The worst part for us was that the main pool area was closed for maintenance during our entire stay. While the adult pool was open, it was so noisy being next to the pool being maintained, couldnt enjoy and read a book out there. While I would recommend this place for those who want the convenience of a kitchen and being off the glare of the strip, for me personally, I like a luxury hotel on the strip much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: mayorphx
Reviews.Content: .Everything about the Grand Desert Resort was first class. Stayed 4 nights in this timeshare resort and loved it. The rooms were very clean and up to date. The pool area and lobby were beautiful. The shuttle service to the strip was great too. The only disappointment was the live music at the pool was so-so and too. loud. That was the only improvement I would make.

Reviews.Title: “Better than noisy, crowded casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrvlngAngyl
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Grand Desert for almost five (5) years. Yes it's off the strip, but sometimes you just want to get away from the noise and lights. If that's what you desire then the Grand Desert is perfect. The staff has always been friendly and helpful. I've stayed with friends and family members, all of various ages and they all love it just the same. They do have a free shuttle that runs to and from the strip, the drop off and pick up is at Bally's Hotel & Casino. But like one reviewer said it does stop at midnight. But if you're out late in Vegas I'm sure you can spare a few bucks on a cab back to your room, it's not going to ruin your night or trip. There are three (3) pools, one (1) which is designated for adults and the others are family orientated. Right inside there's a cafe to get overpriced food if you don't have anything in your room or don't wanna hit the strip :) I've never had a bad experience ever in the past five years..especially bed bugs or beer cans left by the poolside, like some of the other reviewers experienced. The one negative I can say is that they do pressure you hard for a timeshare tour or sale, but if you don't answer your phone or are gone from your room most of the day they can't annoy now can they?!!?

Reviews.Title: “Visited by Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: DeweyStreet
Reviews.Content: Traded into the Wyndham Grand Desert from Club Ragina in Los Cabos as it seemed like a nice option. BIG MISTAKE! While the property has some potential, the major problem is cleanliness. My wife was bitten by bed bugs - and despite several calls to the property management reporting the incident, we have yet to receive any response - it is now October! There are no restaurants or casinos near this property; you are way off the strip - and the limo/bus is very limited - only goes to Harrahs. So, either rent a car or plan on spending money for lots of cabs. Fortunately, we also had booked some nights at the Flamingo - much better!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Vegas Luxury but just Grand!”
Reviews.Author: cardigran
Reviews.Content: We had a week here as RCI exchange guests after touring the National Parks of Utah, and found it more than sufficient for our needs and quite well positioned on Harmon for taking or leaving the "Strip". I'd say it's a good 10 minute walk from the madness,and Harmon brings you onto the Strip at the new Miracle Mile Mall , which is air conditioned and smoke free.We dodged through these shops a lot to cool down and breathe some fresh air on our way back to the hotel.The hotel runs a free shuttle to Harrahs,but the bus garage there is not the greatest place to wait for the return trip. It is hot ,stinky and full of diesel fumes from all the buses coming in.The casino is low and smoky and you have to walk all the way through.We only used it once, and either walked or took the car, accessing the strip hotels parking from Koval.Do not drive on the strip if you can help it. NO NO! Get a decent map and use the streets on either side,and only cross the Strip with the lights. It was unseasonably hot during our stay in Vegas for the end of September,but the hotel was always deliciously cool and totally smoke free ,but not chilly, and the climate in the apartment worked fine although you couldn't turn it off at night and it did disturb slightly kicking off and on,with the noise. The well appointed kitchen had new appliances which were spotless ,the units were wood and a little old fashioned, but not shabby.Only four of everything was a little spare considering there is a full size dishwasher. The bed was fabulous ,and sadly I couldn't get it on the plane. It's time they made houses in Britain with bedrooms big enough for these Super King beds .I'd love one at home! We had a spa bath in the bedroom,and full size shower in the toilet .Two sinks and vanities meant no arguments in the morning.This in a one bedroom deluxe. Furnishings were unremarkable in the rest of the apartment .The chair and sofa had thin ,hard and quite uncomfortable, in my opinion ,arms .I suppose that kept people from sitting on the arms, but I gave up trying to get comfy in the chair and joined my husband on the sofa. The decor was neutral and a bit bland,but the apartment seemed very clean and well maintained. I loved the carpet pattern on the main hallway corridors,it reminded me of being on board a cruise ship, as we had a long windowless passageway to walk to our room. We always found a space in the underground car park for our rental.It smelt a bit funky down there ,like melting rubber, but the car didn't roast in the 100 degree sun, and the elevators took you all the way down.You had to activate the elevators with your passkey by way of security, and there were four off the main foyer in Belle Torre,which were hard worked on checkout day. Pools were quite attractive ,but you had to run for the shade by 10am,so we weren't down there that much.Left that to the sun worshippers. We liked the Wyndham just fine,but you didn't really feel you were in Vegas once you walked through the doors. Maybe that was no bad thing!

Reviews.Title: “Good but AVOID (or exploit) timeshare hawks”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveller45963
Reviews.Content: Place is good but location is off strip. They DO NOT have 24 hours free shuttle or any train connectivity to come back from strip. Last shuttle is at midnight. Good for famillies but not for couples when you want to see shows and hangout in clubs/casinos. Timeshare hawks are abundant and ready to sell you points (not nights). They offer atleast 75CAD dining coupons and show tickets (of back seats of Jublee) if you listen to their (2 hour) crap lies such as you can not book with money but with points only. Listen to them get your vouchers but do not buy because they lie. Tell them on their face that you will investigate their claims and ask to give offer in writing, which they wont. They will always be rude in the end so be prepared to shout back at them. They do not even spare seniors and women in hurling insults if you don't buy approx 20000USD worth points. So they deserve to be insulted back and be exploited for coupons.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Thugs in the 24 hour pool”
Reviews.Author: surfsideguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Desert for 6 nights (8-20/26). Check in was great except for Time share Hawkers. Room was OK..Terrible water pressure in shower..Bed in Master was awful..foot was higher than head. Decided to take a swim at 5:00 a.m. of my first night as I could not sleep. The Pool area was disgusting-empty liquor bottles and beer cans everywhere..Pee filled coke bottles were all around the spa. I guess they did not have keys to enter the restrooms. The area was full of loud unsavory characters. Upon entering the lobby we were met by 5 or 6 men who did not have a card to activate the elevator. When we refused to let them use our card they were threatening and got in our faces using obsenities. This was reported to Management and could be confirmed through their security cameras if they were working..Report was made but that was it! Requested a 3:15 a,m wake up call that never was received. I go to Vegas four times a year and will not return. Thank goodness this was a free Birthday gift!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for families, very quiet!”
Reviews.Author: E3mom
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Las Vegas with 3 young kids. The place overall was clean and comfortable. We exchanged to this location and they tried to get us to go to a "breakfast to discuss the exchange process which will be no longer than 90 minutes" and offered $150 in dining credit at bunch of restaurants. I declined and they didn't push it which I appreciated. They did call 2 other days during the week and I declined both times. I met someone at the pool who told me she went to the presentation and spent 3 hours being talked into buying more weeks. So glad we didn't go to that! The place is clean and very quiet. We didn't hear any neighbors or footsteps above us at all. The kitchen had all the usual amenities and a fridge that had an ice maker which was very convenient. The AC worked very well considering it was 100+ most of the days. Some complaints I have is that the family pool was closed on 2 separate occasions and is small and only goes to about 3 1/2 feet even though the sign said 4 feet.. We ended up going to the very small pool in tower 3 when the family pool was closed and the adults there looked at us like we didn't belong there, but then other people with kids started to arrive. I like the on site store and the cafe although the price of food at the cafe was pricey, but that's what you get for convenience I guess. We tried to take the shuttle to Harrah's once and waited and waited, but decided it would be faster to drive since parking on the strip is free anyways. Would be nice if the shuttle had a schedule, but we were told it just runs periodically because of the traffic on the strip. The staff was friendly, except for the people we encountered at the Concierge desk. The 3 people we met there were not very friendly or much help. Had better service at other concierge desks at other hotels on the strip. Would stay there again since the location was convenient and the place was clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: srikanthps
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal place for folks traveling with kids, close to the strip. It has two pools - one for kids and another for adults, remains open until 10pm. The 2 bed suite was spacious and fit the 6 folks (2 kids + 4 adults) comfortably. Comfy beds, good utensils etc. the kids loved the recreation room with Xbox, Wii, Pool etc. We had to extend our trip by one day due to personal reasons and the manager was really helpful in accommodating the request. Folks at the front desk were very helpful, overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: forwhite
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is not a place for children, but that being said we had a terrific stay at the Grand Desert. The 2 bedroom suite was very large and clean. The furniture was all extremely comfortable and the kitchen was well stocked with all the necessities. We were able to walk to both the Hard Rock and PlanetHollywood Hotels. The free shuttle service to Harrah's was easy to catch and convenient to ride. The swimming pool was shallow, but cool and refreshing in the 112* heat. We used this hotel for our home-base and drove to Utah for an amazing adventure to Zion National Park and Bryce Canyon. The natural beauty of the Parks provided a wonderful contrast to the chaos of LV.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we were only four travelers or would have been way too crowded”
Reviews.Author: JcatsMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Wyndham Grand Desert. We purchased there one year ago during a time share presentation. As temporary VIP's we were able to book with a point reduction, but not able to enjoy a free room upgrade. I did try daily for a month to get the upgrade to a larger unit. Do not waste your time with the "owner satisfaction survey" which was another sales presentation. The survey which was to last 15 to 20 minutes was 2 hours long. Not interested AT ALL in our satisfaction, just wanted to get more of our money on the pretense of better service at the next level of ownership. I pointed out we were not getting what we were "promised" at this level, so we did not believe we would get more at the next level and were not going to risk more money to find out if it was true or not. The room was immaculate and nicely appointed. I would have been extremely upset had we booked the 2 bedroom for the 8 people it can supposedly hold because we would have been on top of each other. For four of us it was okay, but could have used another chair in the living room. Also, no luggage/suitcase stands provided for second bedroom and with 2 beds that could accomodate four people, the need for luggage stands was real. Pools and hot tubs were lovely. Grounds were immaculate. Wished the pools were open later. Kitchen very well stocked. Beds were reallllllly comfy. Would rather stay on strip in the future. Feel we overpaid for this timeshare. If you buy here on the re-sale market, instead of paying "full" price then it might be worth it. Used the free shuttle to Harrah's daily, helped to save on cab fares. Can't say anything is wrong with property or stay, just not worth the price we paid. Our group was aged 45 to 80 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Off strip location not great for couples”
Reviews.Author: umass123
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying a typical day for my wife and I in Vegas starts off in morning at the gym, then to the pool during the day, then dinner and casino for the night. The hotel room is just a place to rest our heads and stop in to relax from time to time, not a place to hang out in for extended periods of time. Very good resort for a family, many kid friendly activities and clearly outside of the "what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas" atmosphere. Has a decent pool scene with a segregated adult pool with a pool bar (you are also free to bring your own cooler full of adult beverages, just no glass containers poolside). The gym is okay with all the necessary equipment and cardio machines however it lacks the amenities of a health club that many of the other Vegas hotels have (such as steam baths, saunas etc). Some of the biggest drawbacks are there is no onsight or adjacent nightlife, casino or restaurant. The nearest casinos are Planet Hollywood, MGM and the Hard Rock which are all about a 10+ minute walk away. The walk is not necessarily bad during the day (although hot), but it does not appear to be the safest at night with a lot of dark desolate stretches of sidewalk. Wyndham does provide a shuttle that runs every half hour until around 10PM and a cab ride is relatively inexpensive depending how far down the strip you are. There also is a small lobby lounge/bar that has a handful of video poker and slot machines that stays open until 1 or 2am depending on how busy it is. I would definitely recommend this to families or people not looking to stay out late. Also, the kitchen is a good perk if you are looking to save by cooking in a lot. The unit is nice in roomy, but many hotels in Vegas offer larger rooms and suites if you need more space. Personally, I prefer a hotel that has a casino and restaurants onsight where I don't have to venture far from my room. With all the great hotels and casinos in Vegas I would definitely pass on the Wyndham Grand Desert next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lansd1
Reviews.Content: The Las Vegas Grand Desert Resort was really nice and the activities available at the resort kept my family busy after retruning each day from our basketball tournament games.

Reviews.Title: “ok stay”
Reviews.Author: jessicastl
Reviews.Content: Well seeing as to how it has been a year since staying at this location i will share what thoughts that I can remember. Well this was a sort of free stay from Wyndam timeshare organization. I had a high floor room overlooking the pool. Having a one bedroom suite with two beds, a living room and kitchen area was great for my needs. Bedroom has its own tv and phone. Living room area was decent sized and i do believe the sofa was a pull out/sleeping kind but the one in the room was not real comfortable just for sitting. Kitchen area has a full sized fridge, stove top, microwave, dishwasher and all cookware and utensils. The location to me was also a plus, it was not far from the strip area so it was quiet it is the corner from MGM so also not in a secluded area. Having a car does not limit your activities if you want to shop, see and do other things. (parking is free for an street and also some covered underground parking). But they do provide a shuttle free of charge for travel to the strip. There are like three of four towers I stayed in the main tower (that housed checkin area etc) so i was happy with my location. I did not use the pool or any other facilities since i was there to shop, eat and lose money. The city was working on water pipes or something so at times during the day constuction/city workers made entering and leaving hotel hard but since i was on the opposite end of this i did not hear any noise. I did not encounter any staff problems because i had no needs for their assistance. But will say if you do not own a timeshare they will call to have you attend a presentation for ownership. By the time they reached me it was at the end of my stay so i declined but usually you get cash, gift cards or free nights stay to attend the presentations so at times it is worth the couple of hours of your time it is your call. All in all i was happy with my stay if possible would stay again here again or away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: MakeCandy
Reviews.Content: Wyndham Grand Desert Resort in Las Vegas, NV The six of us arrived at the Las Vegas, NV airport and hired a Taxi/Van service to take us to the resort. It was only a few minutes ride to WGD and cost $6 each. We arrived about 6 hours prior to check-in; however, WGD was able to accommodate us with an available room promptly. The unit was a 3-BR condo with two baths, a Jacuzzis, a full kitchen & dining area, a washer/dryer combo with a flat-screen TV in each room. There were a total of 4 beds with a sleeper/sofa in the living room. The unit would sleep 8-10 persons. The unit was lovely internally; however, the only negative of this unit was that the windows facing the Las Vegas strip had several pigeons that lived on the seals just outside the windows. The resort is located just less than 1 mile from the Las Vegas strip on Harmon Ave. Amenities included a free shuttle to and from Harrah's on the strip, computer rooms, activity rooms, work-out rooms, swimming pools, hot tubs, restaurants, grocery store, free DVD usage, etc. There are several shuttles, and tours that you can schedule from the lobby that have fees. There are also several activities that you can sign up for such as messages, arts & crafts, etc. The amenities are nice. What I liked the most about the resort was the convenience of everything, but what I liked the least was the hard-sell on the Timeshares. Overall my family and I had an outstanding and relaxing vacation, and I would definitely go there again, but not when it is so hot outside. WP from Chicago, IL.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Good Value, Not bad location....”
Reviews.Author: sixpack069
Reviews.Content: My g/f and her family and I stayed here in a 2 bedroom delux from July 4th-7th. WE got a great deal value wise and deciced to stay here. They said the room slept 8 and I guess it did but for the seven of us it was a little crowded but not horrible. I had stayed here before and this 2 bedroom seemed smaller that the 2 bedroom I stayed in previously. The living room was pretty small and compact but we made it work. The master bedroom was nice, large bathroom w/ jacuzzi hot tub was cool. The kitchen was a lilttle small but it served it purpose fine. The staff was pretty good as we did not have to wait long for service when we called them. The location is OK not the best and not horrible. It is not on the strip, its close maybe 4-5 blocks off it. I walked several times and even in 112 degree heat it took me maybe 10-15 mins to reach the strip. The biggest problem I have with the Wyndham is the PARKING!!! They do not have the parking to accomodate the tenants staying here. The parking garages are a diaster.. as they fill up in the evening and there is no outside parking. It got very old quickly driving around like a clown looking for parking. The resort security is also a JOKE, as we notified the staff of people double parking and they seemed like that did not care or were too lazy to act on it. The pool is a no frill basic pool. It is vanilla in every way. One day we went swimming in the morning and a bunch of people like in they're 60-70s glared at us. It was "adult hour" and I guess they did not like that fact that we had a kid in the pool. Oh well. The fact that they also charge for wifi sucked balls as well. All in all this place is pretty good for the price and I would stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a perfect location right on the strip!!”
Reviews.Author: BobnRobinHowell_MI
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom condo with family from July 4th - 8th. The condo was very spacious, clean and decorated nicely. Had a fully equipped full kitchen with a coffee maker and refrigerator/ice machine that came in handly with the very warm weather. The pools (adult & children) were very nice and not overly crowded like the hotels on the strip. The grounds and hotel were very well kept. The cafe on premises had great food with very reasonable prices. The tiki bar at the adult pool offered specials and the drinks were good and reasonably priced. The daily shuttle that ran to and from the strip was perfect. The hotel offers the same pricing as Tiks4Less on the strip without having to wait in the long lines each morning. The staff was very accomodating and helpful with whatever we needed. This is the second Wyndham my husband and I have stayed at this year and we have been very pleased. We are staying at the Wyndham in San Diego and In San Antonio later this year and are looking forward to it. We did go on the Time Share presentation and didn't feel pressured into buying. The salesperson was very nice..

Reviews.Title: “fantastic family friendly hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: sukidsntravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in May and have to say it was a quiet oasis in the heart of wild vegas! Easy walk to the strip - if feeling enegetic but i would advise (especially if you have kids) to drive to another hotel and park in their carpark - for free. There is lots of walking beware!!! I tuly believe this is an excellent location, they offer free shuttles to and from Harrahs and were regular and reliable in our experience. Concierge and the all general staff were extremely knowledgeable and gave great tips on where to go and eat. Ellis Island was great for cheap and lovely food. Now for the resort itself. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment which was modern, fully furnished and immaculately clean. Loved the welcome pack with the free popcorn - nice touch. We had a room overlooking the pools which was great. Felt very safe in this hotel and it was always quiet - only negative is that the elevators/lifts were an absolute nightmare as you had to put your room key in to take you to the floor you needed and i seemes to have the knack of demagnetising my room key!!! Other than that it was faultless - the staff went out of their way to help you and make your holiday special. The family pool was great and the two jaquzzis/spa. There was lots of entertainment along the pool side and the female singer was excellent - loved the music quiz. Never found a problem getting a lounger there always seemed to be plenty to go around. It was a shame that the pool was in the shade most of the afternoon, but having said that it was perfect for the kids as it ensured they stayed out of the sun in the incredible heat! If i was to return to Vegas with the kids i would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Rooms In A Good Location”
Reviews.Author: photoguy66degrees
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Wyndham Grand Desert while our daughter/husband and children (teen and 5 y/o) spent a time share week. We were able to get adjoining and connecting rooms. They had a larger unit with two bathrooms and a large dining/kitchen area. We had a small kitchen/living room area. This was perfect for visiting with great "Nana and Papa time". The two pools (one adult and one family/children) were excellent for family or adult fun in the sun or just working on the suntan! I personally found the phone call to remind us of the 10 a.m. check out time and an insistent suggestion that we do a "wake up call" annoying (it is a time share property that does "hotel" accomodations). Our room was a bit small (but we were not in it enough for this to be a problem) and otherwise comfortable. The property in general was in excellent condition, everything worked, and we were not bothered by noise. The air temperature was up to 108 during our stay but the room air conditioning worked quite well. The location is excellent for walking to the strip! We took advantage of the "mini kitchen" and prepared our breakfasts in our room.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: BonVintage
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here many times. It is a lot more crowded than it used to be. It would be an excellent place to stay with childred. They have a noisy pool for kids/families and an adult pool. If you must have sun forget it past about 3 or 4 p.m. because it's all in the shade by then. The rooms are in perfect condition. They offer lots of activities for all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Flowergirl20
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Las Vegas. We are Wyndham timeshare owners. We had a 1 bedroom unit and it was perfect. The location is off the strip which some may find "inconvenient". However, if you have a car (which I HIGHLY recommend!!) then it's no problem. There's plenty of parking too. The location is convenient - 10 min drive from airport, 2 min drive to the "strip", and great side streets to avoid traffic on LV blvd. The unit was spacious and had everything we needed - full kitchen, washer/dryer, ironing board, and whirlpool. There are 3 pools so we never felt over-crowded. There's an onsite cafe in the main tower that served pretty yummy food. The only downside is that WiFi is an additional charge. We paid $30 for the week. My personal opinion is that EVERY hotel/timeshare should have FREE WiFi these days! It annoyed me that Super Motel 8 across the street advertised free WiFi - UGH! Hopefully one-day they will upgrade the timeshare unit and join the cyber world and have in-room WiFi available to all their guests at no additional charge. If you are a first-timer to Las Vegas, here's the best advice I got from some friends who frequent vegas - RENT A CAR! That was the best thing we did. There is sooooo much walking in vegas. The hotels are massive and all you do is walk. It is so convenient to drive to a hotel and park in their self parking lots for FREE. Trust me, after you park... you will WALK! On our first day in vegas, we chose to leave the car at the hotel and walk. It was about 110-degrees out and we walked for almost 5 hrs and only saw Planet Hollywood. Needless to say, we drove for the rest of the time. Also, if you choose to walk and stay at this hotel, the walk can be "scary" in the evening. All the more reason to drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas getaway!”
Reviews.Author: MTOATS
Reviews.Content: My husband, parents, brother and sister in law all met in Las Vegas for a Labor Day weekend getaway. We'd gotten a two bed/two bath unit for all of us. If a three bedroom was available, it would have been perfect, but a two bedroom unit worked for us. Our unit had a great view of the strip, as we were on the 14th floor. The unit was very clean and spacious. My group spent some time downstairs at the pool(s), there's a family pool and an adults only pool, which was very nice. We also really enjoyed the small cafe just off the adult pool. The resort offers a free shuttle to the strip, but we had our own cars, so it wasn't needed. It's a really nice service, though. The location is decent, but a bit away from the strip by a few minutes. We really enjoyed this resort and will definitely return soon! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “It was decent stay.”
Reviews.Author: j0mama481
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the first week of May. The room is pretty spacious and clean. Our room was facing in an angle looking towards the strip. Much updated is needed on the rooms, for instance the appliances. The pools isn't something to go crazy for. It's pretty average. Overall, I thought it was okay. I would like to give a special recognition to a certain manager there. His name is Edwin P. He took great care of us when we had a certain incident there. Thanks Edwin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls' Week”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Grl_Mke
Reviews.Content: A friend has a timeshare with the Wyndham and graciously offered it up for our first of what I hope will be many girls' weeks. We had a two-bedroom suite which was adequate for the five of us, but the three-bedroom would have been ideal. The cab ride from the airport was reasonable and with the free shuttle we did not find a need for a rental car. If you desire to venture off the strip, you may want to consider one. One of the nice things about the Wyndham is they have planned activities if you care to participate. Part of our group enjoyed morning outing for the Red Rock tour. They do offer massages at the resort, but if you're expecting a true spa experience, you will want to look elsewhere. The fitness center was nice and adequate for a vacation workout and the adults-only pool is fantastic. This was a girls' week after all, no partners and no kids! The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. The business center was a drawback; it was populated with children facebooking and was not monitored so that those of us who had business to conduct had to wait for a computer to free up before we could begin our day.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: huskyal02
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st time in Vegas and I purposely picked this place because it is close to the strip but yet, not on the strip. We came out here for my wedding and I had another stayed with me in the 2 BR suite and my photographer and his wife stayed at the 1 BR suite. The service was great and the rooms were clean. We did not cook but everything you need were there. The staffs were friendly and we rented the Gabana and they were pretty cool too...with a fan and cable TV. I would come back again and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Where Do I Begin”
Reviews.Author: CeCeVacation
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin. I had high expectations for this resort for 2 reasons, first it was a gold crown resort and second because it's a Wyndham. I am a timeshare owner at Grandview Resort in Las Vegas but RCI gave me a choice between the Wyndham or Grandview. I chose the Wyndham because it seem a little bit closer to the strip then Grandview. The resort on the outside look great but after a long day of traveling, all we wanted to do was check into the resort and relax. On arrival I went to the front desk and I gave the clerk my name and my printed confirmation from RCI. The clerk told me the reservation was canceled. Now clearing since I took a 4 hour plane ride, I didn't cancel my reservation so I was clam and told the front desk clerk, I will wait until he figure something out. After about 10 minutes, he found me a room and then told me the cost for a cleaning fee was $65. I had to stop him for a minute because RCI told me the cost was $40. He told me $40 was the cost of a standard 1 bedroom, since I was getting the deluxe it was $65. I was so tired, so I agreed to pay the $65. We rented a car for 1 day so we had to go across the room to get the parking pass. The guys on the other end of the room was very nice and helpful. Little did I know it was a timeshare hustle. I told then I already had a timeshare and he said, this wasn't a presentation, this was a update for people who already own a timeshare because Wyndham bought RCI. "It would only be about an hour" he said. I believed him and signed up for the "update" which was for the next morning at 9am. Once in the room, I was excited because it was very nice and Gold star quality. We had a back view so no view of the strip. I was fine with that. Later that night we went to bed and it was a little hot, we set the AC down to about 60 and went to bed. The next morning was my so called "update". Needless to say this was a full on timeshare presentation. I was not happy being in that room for almost 2 1/2 hours. While, I was at the presentation, my guest told me the mircowave wasn't working so he requested for them to replace it, which they did. By the ending of the night we realized the room was still not getting cool enough, at this point we called the front desk and they had someone to come and check it out. Maybe because it was 10pm but the maintaince guy came upstairs and pretty much said it was broken, to call back in the morning to get a new room. My boyfriend and I was a little upset because after 2 days in the resort we made ourselves pretty comfy and really didn't feel like moving to a new room. The next morning, I called to front desk and requested to speak to a manager, he sent a AC repair man within 20 mintues he had the AC fixed. The rest of our stay was pleasent until we had to check out. We requested a late check out but I guess no one made a note of it and we got lock out of our rooms at 10am. We had to go through security in get back into our rooms. After we finally checked out, I had to call RCI about the cleaning fee and they told me, they have no record of the $65 charge. It was suppose to be $40 no matter what size room we stayed in. Of course, I was not happy at all and RCI told me I should have called them when we had trouble checking in on day one. Needless to say, RCI gave me back my exchange charge for the incovience and promise to look into the room cleaning fee at the Wyndham. I really didn't know what to say at this point. The resort is very nice but we just had very bad luck at this location. Would I say again? No. It is very family friendly, the shuttle is very helpful, the walk to the strip is about 10 minutes but its not a bad walk. The staff is super nice and very helpful. I hope I was helpful, good luck at the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Got the Chance to Stay Here? Do!”
Reviews.Author: roadtriperArizona
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a business trip to Vegas where we shared a 3 bedroom unit at the Grand Desert with some of our business partners. This resort made our trip enjoyable and peaceful. The unit was awesome, everyone had plenty of space and we created some memorable meals in our well equipped kitchen. We even invited friends to dine with us around our table for 10. The service was exceptional from check in to check out. The gal who helped us with our luggage was especially efficient and delightful. This place was a wonderful oasis in the midst of crowds and chaos. We would all recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort, Very clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: jeb45
Reviews.Content: Grand Desert is a great resort. Check in and out was a breeze with very helpful and friendly personel. The resort is well maintained with people constantly cleaning and touching up the facilities. The room we had which was a 1 bd rm deluxe in tower 3 on the 10 th floor was very nice and convenient to the elevators and the shuttles to Harrahs. The shuttle was on time with drivers who were very knowlegeable about the area and they picked you up at the door and delivered you back to the door. The resort was just the right distance from the strip to allow walking or the shuttle. Unless you are ging to take a lot of side trips there is no need for a car. Everyone at the resort was very friendly and helpful. The pool area was very nice and clean with towels ready for use. We did not use the kitchen but it is adequate and very clean. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone who is looking for a nice comfortable resort. We will be going back for many visits in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, if you don't want to hang at the pool.”
Reviews.Author: JST2grls
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a one week stay. We have been to this resort before, but, will probably not go back. Although we found the building we were in very quiet, a chair at the pool was not to be found. Oh, there was a lot of chairs... with towels on them, but it appeared they were not being used. Many people reserve chairs at all the pools at this resort then chair-hop all day.I witnessed this several times. Sun chasers. Because of the way the resort is built around the pool only small areas get the sun for a short time. The unit we were in was at the end of a long hall. Quite a walk to the elevators, but, very quiet, until the people upstairs from us decided to use their whirlpool tub at 3 am. I think it must have been right above our bed! Perhaps a ' Timing Note" could be added somewhere in the users manual on being curtious to others. Check in was very quick. We arrived very early in the morning but they did have our room ready so allowed us to check in then. The 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit was very well furnished with newer furniture and a very well thought out kitchen. Full-sized fridge, stove, microwave. All the dishes needed to prepare a full meal or light snack. The resort is located just off the strip near the MGM. We did not use the shuttle. Car rentals, in Vegas, right now are not expensive. We enjoy day trips so having our own car was much more convenient. We will probably return to Vegas but, will try to trade into a different resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: kdenon01
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice week long stay. It is a quiet and clean resort. The pool is nice and calm. Although, there was an issue of lack of sun chairs. The cafe was really yummy and fast. The location is off the strip. But it is a short walk to MGM, which has the monorail station. The wheelchair accessibility is great! My hubby had no problems getting around. I was not a fan of the shuttle service. Sometimes we would have to wait a while for a shuttle. And once it literally pulled up...tapped it's brakes and left. Which means we had to wait for another to come. Other than those couple of issues, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 Bedroom Presidential is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: addies
Reviews.Content: Someone just cancelled and we snatched up the last 4 bedroom presidential (I think they only have 4 of these rooms). It was room 1571 (right near the elevator) in Tower 2 (main front desk tower) I love the presidentials because the bedding is like a nice hotel. This place was huge. We had 8 adults, 2 children and 2 infants and we had plenty of space. It is 2 master bedrooms with a king bed and bathroom. And 2 other rooms with 2 double beds in each. And 2 outside bathrooms. So in total 2 king beds, 4 doubles and 4 bathrooms. It has a huge dining table and leather sofas. Unfortunately we had a room overlooking the pool. So we didn't get the nice view of the strip but that's okay. It was such a great time. We loved it so much. We've stayed at this Wyndham location multiple times over the past few years. If you have the points I would definitely try to snatch up a 4 bedroom presidential. Great if you have kids because of the full kitchen. We can store milk in the fridge and wash bottles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At Wyndham Grand Desert”
Reviews.Author: ptkCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Spent one week at the resort from 2/27/10 to 3/6/10. First time staying here although I have owned a timeshare at this resort for some time. Arrived early but was not able to check in. Was able to leave bags and journey out to get a bit to eat. The Ellis Island Casino down the street has very good food and is more of a locals casino but great to gamble at. We asked to be called when the room was ready but when we got back we were able to get our keys and go up to the room. Room was very nice with a view of the pool area. The pools ( there are three all together and four hot tubs ). Only complaint was that the hot tubs were closed in the main area at 9:00 PM but the other building ( Bldg. 3 ) was open very late. Other than no casino on site ( did have a small lounge with slots machines ) which was actually nice, we very much enjoyed our stay and look forward to our next visit. The walk to the strip was about 15 minutes but we used the shuttle to Harrah's which was great.

Reviews.Title: “sunny, very hot beautiful hotel expensive”
Reviews.Author: alexbellerby
Reviews.Content: sunny, very hot beautiful hotel, expensive but worth it, lots of casinos and huge hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Average property”
Reviews.Author: tdeaster
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Grand Desert is about 2 blocks off the strip. I stayed two nights with my wife. Service from the time we arrived was excellent. The staff was couteous and very responsive to our needs. Check in was very quick painless. We stayed in Tower 3 which has the 24 hour pool and hot tub outdoor. The hot tub was hotter than expected but enjoyable once the sun set and temp dropped. I had a slight accident the first evening and called maintenace to report damage in the bathroom. The first question asked was if I was okay and I was. However within 5 mins after the call they had 2 security guards at our door with an emergency kit to follow up on the incident. That was impressive! The hotel/resort property was not bad but it wasn't what I would expect from a large player in the resort business. The suite was spacious for a 1 bedroom, however the walls of the suites are very thin. Without strain we could hear our neighbor's conversations and one of the mornings we could hear their breakfast frying in the pan!The quality of the furnature and cabinetry in the kitchen, dining area and living room was not the best quality. Nothing was broken but I could tell it would not take much to break it. The bed was very uncomfortable. The matress is one that I would expect in a lower end motel. All the pools are good in size but the decks seem small and difficult to accomdate any large activities. Overall, I would stay at the Wyndham Grand Desert again. The friendliess and service of the staff makes up for some if its short comings!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort!!”
Reviews.Author: myecon
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and clean resort. My wife and I stayed here twice. It's close, but yet far enought from the strip so you can relax. This is truely a resort that allows you flexibilty to relax or go all out. They have activities to keep you involved or you can relax at one of the three pools or hot tub. I would highly recommend going to the gaming lessons class that's offered twice a week and it is FREE!! It will help understand and improve your gaming experience in BJ, Craps, and Roulette. We like going to Ellis Island a few blocks away. We rented car and found a Super Walmart and stocked up on few snacks and bottle water. The room was very well stocked to give you the feeling of being at home if you wanted to cook. I cooked breafast a few times in the moring and we made sandwiches. I used the workout room several times during the week to work off all the buffets. The service and the staff are very nice. I think you would be very pleased if you stay here for an extended amount of time to take Las Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very afforable, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: TychoBoy
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas two years ago with my parents and my girlfriend to celebrate my 19th birthday. My parents had stayed here on past trips and highly recommended it for our vacation. Boy, were they right! The Wyndham is a beautiful, clean and very affordable hotel to stay at. While not as extravagant as the other hotels on the strip, its "toned" down style provides more privacy, relaxation and fewer disturbances to contend with. The room was very nice and had lots of room for four people to share comfortably. As it is located just beyond the main attractions of Vegas, coming to and from the hotel becomes a far less stressful ordeal. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers who like things a little upper-class but still want to be budget conscious while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “What an Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: furnituremill
Reviews.Content: We took my Sister n law and future Brother n law to Vegas to get married on 02/10/2010 we stayed in one of the 3 bedroom Presidential Suite....WOW!! it was absolutely beautiful, the staff was so friendly, we took their shuttle to the Von Grocery Store twice and took the shuttle to Harrah's numerous times, the shuttle was there within 20 minutes. The pools were heated and the beds were so confortable, the only problem we had is that the web site said that the Suites had a pull-out bed in the couch, ours did not. It was great having a Washer, Dryer and Dishwasher in the room and the Hot tub was so relaxing. Make sure you go see the Hoover Dam, The staff at Wyndham will book your trip for you and any other shows you want to go see. I would highly recommend this location for your stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: J2810
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week as a timeshare exchange. We have stayed at The Cliffs at Peace Canyon before and thought that due to the Wyndham's location it would make more sense to stay nearer to the strip. When we arrived, the check-in staff were very helpful and friendly. We arrived at approximately 5pm and were pleased to discover that we had been given a room overlooking the pool. As we are from Scotland and sun deprived, we enjoy spending some days relaxing in the sun, however I was surprised to see that the main pool area was completely shaded due to it being surrounded by condos on all four sides. In the end we found that one of the other towers has a smaller pool area which suited our needs better anyway since it was nearly always empty. We later found out that the main pool area does get some sunshine during the day but obviously moves as the sun sets. I was surprised that no one had mentioned this in any other reviews but I suppose the Las Vegas sunshine isn't what draws everyone here. The apartment was very well equipped and sufficient for our needs. There was always ample car parking and the taxi rank at reception was good for going to the strip at night. Overall, we enjoyed our time here and would return if we were looking to stay somewhere reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will probably return.”
Reviews.Author: rayski4
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for a week and flipped a timeshare for this unit. As other reviews have indicated the location is off strip and the walk is not too bad. The room was nice and clean, we have no complaints at all. The staff was very friendly. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: RoyR
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the stay at the Grand Desert. While I had no interaction with staff, the room was very large, well appointed and very clean. Our room had two bedrooms, a large sitting area, dining area and full kitchen. There was popcorn, coffee, creamer, hot chocolate, dishwashing liquid etc... I was really impressed with all the little extras in the room. The washer and dryer were also a big plus. The "off the strip" location was quiet and relaxing. It was still an easy walk (5-10 minutes) to the strip. Not having to navigate through smoky casinos on the way to the room was a welcome reprive! I'd be very happy to stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend this place. My only suggestion would be to offer guests a little more options for getting coffee, creamer or basic groceries. The small shop on the property was sporatically closed and did not see well stocked. Getting a few groceries or extras really requires a car and quite a bit of searching.. My brother and I were attending classes at Front Sight and we found this to be an easy 1 hour commute and much nicer than the offerings in Pahrump!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort right off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Wailym
Reviews.Content: This resort is GREAT! We stayed for almost a week, between Christmas and New Years day. I have nothing bad to say about this place. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, very spacious and comfortable. It has a fully equipt kitchen, bathroom and bedroom. Our room overlooked the pool grounds, but we were high enough to see some of the city skyline. The resort is VERY close to the north end of strip. The walk to the MGM Grand is approx. 3/4 mile. If you walk in the other direction you will be near Flamingo, Ceasars, Bellagio area in about the same distance walk. We walked everywhere! The resort does offer a free shuttle to Harras and back, very convenient. The shuttle ran from 10am to 9:30pm. The Rio shuttle runs a little later and will drop you off at the Wyndham. The shuttle drivers are very friendly and informative, gave us advice on anything we asked. The outdoor pools at resort are heated and hot tubs were a great treat in the mornings! There are 4 pools and hot tubs, some adult only. The restaurant is not really a restaurant but an order counter. The food is good and they have a good selection. They do have Starbucks coffee both at the counter and in the main lobby. They also have a bar on main lobby. Also on the second floor of main tower they have a game room and internet room. We were able to print our boarding passes! The resort alos offers a selection of daily scheduled activities. Like trips to Freemont St., crafts and shopping. This resort is mainly timeshare owned, so maid service is not offered daily, unless you book it that way. We did not book maid service, but had extra towels ect under the bathroom sink. And we didnt have to worry about the maid knocking every morning! The Bell service was excellent providing taxis and area information. The concierge was great with ticket info. On New Years Eve they had live music enterainment and offered free champagne, mimosas and snacks. Very festive! This is a great alternative off the strip, no casino, quiet affordable retreat, but still very close to everything. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Jolie618
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, 4 friends, and I went to Vegas for New Years 09/10 and stayed at the Wyndham. We all had a blast! This is a great resort where you can sleep away from the hustle and bustle on the strip and have all the amenities to really make yourself at home. The customer service was great. Check-in was easy. During our stay a representative called to ask if we need anything and make sure we were happy. The concierge had good recommendations. And the bellman was always there to hail us a taxi. We never used the shuttle because it only drops you off at Harrah's and we were going to hotels too far way (and to cold) to walk. A taxi cab ride is about $5 if there's not too much traffic. We loved our room! We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite. We were able to sleep all 6 of us comfortably. The master bedroom had a great jacuzzi tub. We had all the appliances and kitchenware we needed. The resort was quiet - I was never woken up by noisy neighbors or anything. My only complaint is that there is no maid service. Fortunately were were only there for 3 nights and didn't really need it. The resort itself is nice and well-maintained. It was nicely decorated for Christmas. We never used any of the amenities - pool, spa, planned activities, shuttle - so I can't really comment on that. Overall, I would highly recommend this resort for families, singles, young people who want to party, everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: jasruth
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Grand Desert was a pretty nice place to stay. We went at Christmas time, and the place had been decorated very nicely to reflect the time of year. The rooms were clean, staff friendly and helpful, and everything worked. Parking never seemed to be a problem even though there were a lot of people. Located not far from "the Strip" getting in and out was not an issue once you know your way around a bit. The hotel is situated right on a main north/south street that parallels the strip, so we found it easy to avoid negotiating that traffic nightmare. They also offer a free shuttle that runs bask and forth the Harrah's, but we didn't try it. They had several outdoor pools and hot tubs but being December we didn't try it. They claim to have WiFi access, but we could never connect with any reliability.

Reviews.Title: “Next Door's Guests Did Us In”
Reviews.Author: susienew
Reviews.Content: Last minute, we visited the Grand Desert on December 12 for two nights. This was our first time in one of their regular one bedroom suites. We have always received the deluxe rooms before in the past 6-7 visits. None was available this time due to the rodeo events. Unfortunately, being in one of the lock-off units with a slim door separating two rooms, the insulation was poor. The next door guests were elderly with medical issues, It's not their fault but because of the husband's chronic coughing and spitting up sputum, we could hear everything and we slept on and off for the two nights. They were also hard of hearing and had to shout their conversations. We learned alot about them and their plans in the late evening and early morning. At 7am on the morning of our departure and hoping to sleep in late, the husband woke up, coughing and spitting and he turned the bedroom tv on full blast to CNN. I called the front desk to at least have the volume turned down. Security came and there was quietness. But it was shortlived. He then switched on the tv in the living room full blast and began making breakfast loudly. Then I heard their door open and then someone fiddling with our door knob. Before I could get out of bed to check out the clamor, the noise stopped. We discovered our newspaper, available for VIP gold and platinum members and usually hanging from the doorknob, missing. No problem. I later went down to the front desk to get another one. We never met the next door guests. We wish them well and to good health hopefully. We loved the opening of the Oasis for cocktails and the slot machines on the ground floor. Hurrah's operates it so you can't charge your drinks to your room. The timeshare survey presentation has been changed for owners. They now come to your room with a 20 question survey and upon completion you will receive a $25 dining voucher. All in all the trip would have been enjoyable if we had some restful sleep. We will return without any hesitation but will request deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: kentmoney1
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times and this stay by far was the best. A full kitchen and a Spa in the bathroom was a fine touch to the stay. I recommend this The Grand Resort to anyone at anytime

Reviews.Title: “Our experience at the GD was not grand.”
Reviews.Author: gr8day
Reviews.Content: The reason we stayed at this place was my husband was taking business training in Las Vegas and the course was held at the Grand Desert. We decided to fly out the weekend before the training to spend some time together in Las Vegas. We contemplated staying at another hotel on the Strip for Friday and Saturday night but ultimately decided to stay in the GD for the duration. This was our first time to Vegas and our first time experiencing a time share property. The following are the list of reasons our stay was less than grand; 1. They had lost our reservation. This is usually something that can easily be fixed but not at this place. Furthermore, their attitude toward us was bad. After giving them our confirmation number, they were able to find the original reservation but said that it had been canceled. We would not have flow all the way from the east coast if we had canceled the reservation. They asked us who we booked the room with and we gave the name of the lady who books rooms for events such as training (she works in another state on the east coast). Since this is a time share property, they do not have a reservation desk like most hotels and told us quite bluntly that we have to resolve this problem ourselves - we were stunned. We didn’t make the mistake but we had to somehow fix it. Fortunately, we were able to reach the lady on the east coast that originally booked our room (who apparently was the only person who could restore the original reservation) but it took awhile as she couldn’t be reached promptly. We were a little concern that she may not be in the office since it was Friday and getting late in the day on the east coast. When we reached her, she said that it was a glitch in the system and rebooked the room. This was a convenient problem for them as my husband’s credit card had already been billed for the entire stay the day that he made the reservation. So basically we had already paid for a room in its entirety for which we did not even have a reservation. Had we not been able to reach this one person, I don’t think that we would have been able to get another room because they couldn’t make a reservation for us there at the actual property. I call it a property because it really isn’t a hotel – a fact that was made more apparent every day we stayed. By the way, there is a blackout on checking in on Friday which I guess only applies to non-timeshare owners. I think this is why they wouldn’t help us, which leads me to my next complaint. 2. If you are not a time share owner, you are not fit to breath. We were surprised by this treatment. Since we were not time share owners, I would have thought they’d be nice to us in the hopes of becoming time share owners. Every time we approached a staff person that worked at this place to ask them a simple question (like does the shuttle stop at this tower?), it was as if we were bothering them. I went to what is considered the concierge desk to pick up the ‘welcome’ package a couple of days after we checked-in, which was some info on Vegas and the shuttle pass. This is when they try to talk you into a time share presentation. When I indicated we were not interested, the little bit of hospitality that I got ended. The one nice person was Ms. Lynn - one of the shuttle bus drivers. Also, my husband witnessed a little 90 year old lady get kicked off the shuttle bus by another driver at the Harrah’s pickup location since she could not produce a shuttle pass or a room key. Someone from her party was already back at the timeshare and she didn’t have a room key or a shuttle pass on her. Watching their treatment of her was the last straw for him. 3. We keep smelling cigarette smoke. It may have been coming from the next room. I felt like I was back at the casinos when we got back to our room. 4. The location of the property wasn’t that convenient to the strip, the shuttle bus didn’t start until 8:30 am and could be a little slow. I am an early morning person and since I was still on east coast time, 8:30 was too late to wait for a bus to get my day started. Beside I didn’t want to eat breakfast every morning at the GD. We took a taxi every morning and on Monday, I decided to walk – it is a good hike to the strip. Since Vegas requires a lot of walking (if you don’t rent a car), I would recommend staying at a hotel on the strip (or rent a car). Bottom line . . . if you are not a time share owner for wyndham properties and you are just looking to book a hotel in Vegas, I would recommend an actual hotel on the strip. When I go on vacation one of the things that I like is a little bit of room service (i.e., lite clean up, bed service, etc.), which is not going to happen at a time share and particularly not at this place. On the positive side, we stayed in one of the small one bedroom suites, it was nice, but we didn’t use or need the living room/kitchen. Each room does have a W/D which is nice for longer stays. I am glad most enjoyed this hotel but I wonder if they are timeshare owners.

Reviews.Title: “Steps from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: CapriceM
Reviews.Content: Great location.................even better rooms. Very Spacious

Reviews.Title: “This resort was Wonderful!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ssrichardsonoo7
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the resort & enjoyed every minute. The service was excellent & I can't think of one negative thing to say about our stay. Anytime we come to Las Vegas from now on we will stay at the Wyndham Grand Desert!! Great job to all your staff. Mrs. Harry Richardson Eagle, Id.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place To Stay - With One Exception”
Reviews.Author: RCI_Exchanger
Reviews.Content: Our timeshare exchange unit was clean, large, and had everything we needed - including an in-room spa. The full kitchen was well stocked for preparing meals. Staff was friendly and helpful. The 15 minute walk down Harmon Street to the Strip is a gauntlet of construction equipment and blowing dust, so take the free shuttle to Harrah's. The WGDR offers $20, half day tours of Red Rock Canyon and $50 all day tours of Hoover Dam. Both are worth it - especially if you're not winning at the casinos. Shuttles to the grocery store are $2. Check out the Half Price Ticket Offices on the Strip for real bargains on many same day or next day shows. Best thing about the WGDR is the "no smoking" policy -- which brings me to the one exception. Smoking is allowed near the family pool and the main spa, where cigarette and especially CIGAR smoke stink up the entire area. If you don't like this be sure to tell the Manager, as the WGDR Board can move the smoking area or just ban all smoking in public areas. You can avoid second hand smoke at the adult pool or one of the smaller spas -- if you don't have young children.

Reviews.Title: “great place off strip”
Reviews.Author: vonnieskiConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Grand Desert is a great place to stay off the main strip. Rooms were large and very clean and the staff treated us very well and were friendly. Only two down sides. One being that their shuttle is somewhat sporadic and you never know quite when it will arrive. Also, the return late night shuttle ends at 10:30 pm. Although they do have a "sister" shuttle from Harrahs that leaves at 11:30pm. If you miss that one then you have to take a taxi back to the hotel. The cost can be anywhere from $10-25 depending on where you get the cab. Although the brochures state that The Hard Rock Hotel is within walking distance....be prepared to walk about 30 minutes. Their "blocks" are about a mile long! The second downer was with room itself. We had a one-bedroom deluxe, sleep four room. With one bathroom that had two doors. That's NOT the problem. The problem was that over the whirlpool tub, there was an opening, the size of a large window, into the master bedroom. So...if you like privacy in your bath, this is not the place for it. Even though my husband and I have been married 30 years, we still enjoy our "private" time. If we had friends along with us, it would've been very awkward to say the least. The resort is non-smoking, and they truly enforce it. There is one small area designated outside by the pool if you do smoke. The pools and hot tubs are excellent! Very clean and plenty of chairs, tables and loungers. Towels are also provided. The concerige was great. We were able to get the tickets we wanted at reasonable price. Also they have a great activities center that has its' own tours. We took advantage of the Red Rock Canyon tour. The price for this was only $20/PP compared to $70-89 on-line. Fantastic time!! I would recomend this hotel to anyone who does not want to be in the heart of the "strip" scene.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: DebKWashington_D_C_
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Desert for a week in September with another couple. The hotel was clean and spacious, and the front desk was amazing. They helped us plan our trip and outings with a complimentary concierge desk!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Steps from the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: dmtvshow
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had the pleasure of enjoying a great trip to Las Vegas this past summer. We stayed at the Wyndham Grand Desert. The resort is located very close to MGM and is a short walk. There is also a free shuttle bus to take you to and from the strip. The staff was extremely polite and courteous. Upon checking in, we realized the front desk made a mistake and gave us the wrong type of room. After a few minutes and a knock at the door we were greeted with a nice card from the front desk saying sorry about the mix up and they gave us a complimentary bottle of wine and box of chocolate. We stayed in a one bedroom deluxe which was very clean and a nice sized unit. The view was amazing and overlooked the city. The resort has a nice fitness center, computer room, free dvd rentals, swimming pools, full kitchen and appliances and it's like staying in a nice condo. On our final night stay we upgraded to a 3 bedroom Presidential Suite which was an amazing room. Words cannot do this room justice. From the jacuzzi to the massive space to the flat screen television and surround sound system, the room couldn't be better. All in all, everything was great and you can't go wrong staying at this fine resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: lin925
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Wyndham Grand Desert in Las Vegas for a week. We had two of the two bedroom condos. There were seven of us (all related) that went on the trip. From the time we arrived, the staff was very friendly and accomodating. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Everyone we encountered during our stay there was friendly, down to earth and willing to do whatever it took to make it a great experience for us. The rooms were beautiful and very spacious. The master suite had a large jacuzzi tub and seperate shower. The second bedroom also had a full bath. I liked the fact that the two bedrooms were seperated by the kitchen/living room areas. We rode the shuttle that the hotel provided to Harrah's Casino and back every day. This was very convienient since it is a half mile off the strip and there is still a lot of construction in the area. We never had to wait too long for the shuttle on either end and the bus drivers were very friendly. All in all, we loved it and can't wait to stay there again when we go to Las Vegas next year.

Reviews.Title: “The best resort ever. Great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: moses1969indiana
Reviews.Content: We were at the grand desert from Sept 6 thru Sept 13 2009. We arrived early on the 6th and they let us check in early 10:30am instead of waiting until 4:00pm. Our 1 bedroom deluxe was great. Only a couple of small problems and those were taken care of right away. Used the shuttle and it was great and never had to wait long. Customer serivce was above and beyond what we could have expected. This was a trade through RCI and was our best trade yet. I would stay here again. I have been to Vegas many times and this is the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: suzyroed
Reviews.Content: we stayed in room 781 in tower 2. carpets were not clean and the couch seemed like something from a dorm room, worn out and faded. Nice view of the pool. I felt like the things they had to offer were over-rated. pool party everyday meant live music at the pool, they were good musicians, but that was one of the few things that was free. I especially did NOT like the arcade for kids. The had xbox, wii, playstation and arcade games but there were games that were not appropriate for small children, that showed heads being blown off, men being stabbed to death. Just something I try to keep away from my 4yr old. Amazingly they kept a lifeguard on duty even late into the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag...”
Reviews.Author: ba340
Reviews.Content: Getting to the hotel is a challenge with major road repairs on all adjacent streets. Check in easy - one desk for room keys etc, then sent to another 'hospitality desk' for the parking pass etc. That turned out to be more like a timeshare sales desk. I declined the offer of a sales presentation and with that, it was off to the room. The one bedroom suite is smallish but adequate with small kitchenette and washer/dryer etc. If you book through expedia or orbitz etc there is NO HOUSEKEEPING for the duration of your stay. You do have basic cleaning supplies in the suite and can call for extra towels etc. The pool was most disappointing. Pleasant enough to look at but spoiled by the blaring announcements and karaoke style singing from the kids entertainment staff. That ruined all chances of a relaxing afternoon in the sun. THe building is well kept and in good repair. Next time its back to the Hilton Grand Vacations Club which is altogether better in every regard.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: texascouple21
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this resort as a result of a timeshare swap and it was a most enjoyable experience. Las Vegas in July enjoyable? Except for the heat (which the resort couldn't control) the entire stay was one pleasant day after another. There was an adult pool/spa area far enough away from the family area that virtually no kid screaming was noticeable. There were more than enough lounge chairs by each pool and each staff member we talked to was helpful and considerate. The resort was about a mile from "the strip" but my wife and I walked just about every morning and/or evening; the resort had a shuttle to the strip for those so inclined and it ran from early till late. They offered a number of activities each day for adults and kids alike.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as last time”
Reviews.Author: pa_uthe
Reviews.Content: When we went to go to sleep, it was obvious that the bed linens had not been changed from the previous occupant. We phoned the desk and they said someone would be right up to change them. 30 minutes later, no one had showed up and I phoned to cancel and said that we would just sleep on the pull-out sofa for the night. The clerk said we should not do that. We pulled th e sofa open and saw why she had said that( it was pretty disgusting). We reported it again in the morning and housekeeping did come and change the bed. As owners, we requested to speak to someone and the person we spoke to talked in circles and only suggested that we upgrade to permanent VIP status.( does this status mean you do not have to bring your own sheets?). On the whole, this 3 day stay was not up to the standard we had on our previous stay in April.

Reviews.Title: “FREAKIN ROCKED!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: misslaydj
Reviews.Content: though no porch like the one in boring fort lauderdale/pompono beach this was VERY vegas but not in a tacky way. meaning real classy. really nice!! COZY roomy loved it. VERY neat and clean. like living in a 5th ave townhouse in nyc. y stay at a hotel on a drunkin strip when you can here 3 small blocks away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: karyny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wyndham in June for 2 weeks and loved it. We had already read about the timeshare sellers so just politely said NO to anything that came with an offer of freebies so stayed well clear of any bother. Our room was a one bed deluxe which was equiped with everything needed, full kitchen, washer/ dryer, jaccuzi bath. It was all spotlessly clean, yes the rooms were a little dark and the furniture was dark and somewhat old fashioned but it was the best equipped timeshare we have ever stayed in. The staff were fab, very polite and always wanting to help, we used the free shuttle, and the grocery shuttle ( $3 per couple) on numerous occasions and thought it was very well organised. It was a 10 minute walk home from Planet Hollywood casino so in a very good position away from the noise and madness of the strip. We will be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Exchange - Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: leonyrey
Reviews.Content: I use RCI when I can and look for good exchange opportunities. When this came along I jumped at it because of its proximity to the strip and between Hard Rock and Planet Hollywood. But beware 110 degrees in the sun is not a short walk. You are not in the thick of things along the strip but if you want that … then this is not for you. If you have kids with you and want to have them enjoy the pool without being too crowded then you will like this place. The sun shines on the pool from 9 am to 6 pm. There is a family pool and an adult pool. There are activities for the kids to do. You have to pay for internet at your room :-( The lobby and the rooms are great. Better than most condos Just remember that there is a sales call …. RCI remember. Unplug your hotel phone use your cell.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort - very impressed.”
Reviews.Author: DiMiSa
Reviews.Content: We exchanged a week for this resort on RCI. We had a very nice 2 bedroom unit. I was extremely impressed with the cleanliness of the resort and the unit itself. We had no pressure to attend any timeshare presentations. Everyone at the resort was helpful and kind. We spent some time doing different activities - like the Pirate Scavenger Hunt and some of the pool parties. The activities were well planned and a lot of fun. The pool and grounds were meticulously maintained. We even used the shuttle to the strip once and had no issues. Loved the resort! Would recommend for families. We had 5 adults, 9 year old and a toddler with us.

Reviews.Title: “like a vacation home!”
Reviews.Author: VacationLovingFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights at the Grand Desert and were very happy with our stay! Our room was spacious and nicely arranged. We had a one bedroom with a king bed and the kids slept on a pull out couch in the living room. There is a full kitchen with dishes and cooking utensils-everything you may need. There are several Wal-marts close by, plus the hotel has a shuttle for grocery shopping each morning ($3 per person). We had breakfasts and a few lunches in the room to save some time and money. The room was clean and comfortable. We loved having a washer and dryer in the room so we could wash some clothes! The only negatives were: 1) since it is a time share resort, there is no daily housekeeping unless you request (and pay) for it. But, we called for extra bed linens, towels, soap, etc. and received it no problem. 2) the shower head wasn't great--good water pressure but no real showerhead. The location is nice-off the strip but only a few blocks. The hotel has a shuttle that runs to Harrah's, but ends at 9:45pm. We did use the shuttle twice and it was good. We had a rental car that we mainly used--all of the Vegas strip hotels have free parking garages. The pool was great. There is a kids/family pool that ranges from 1-4 feet deep. It was big and great for the kids! There are lots of comfortable lounge chairs at poolside. There is also a lifeguard. There are 2 hot tubs and a separate big pool just for adults. The pool area is beautiful with palm trees, etc. We loved it. Overall, this was a great stay in a nice resort in a great location!!! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK...............but lacked 'soul'.”
Reviews.Author: Carolanne67
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying at the Wyndham Grand Desert but I was a bit disappointed. It is quite a good base for access to the Strip and the free shuttle is very helpful. It's just those little things that begin to irk. The checking in process is fine and we did get given a couple of bags of freebies which included cookies, water and hair bands! The main problem for us was the sheer size of the place - it's huge and has no 'soul'. The pools are way to small for the amount of people staying there. They probably think that people just want to go to the Strip all the time but that's obviously not the case. We had trouble just finding somewhere to sit near the pool. The supermarket was very expensive and for families with no transport that must be very annoying. The fast food place did serve nice and quite reasonably priced snacks but they always seemed to shut early. Not that helpful when you're relying on them for something to eat after a very long day! The unit itself was very clean, comfortable and roomy - especially the bath which a whole football team could have used at the same time! We asked reception for ideas of where to eat within walking distance and they mentioned Ellis Island on Koval Lane. The food here is great and very cheap. This was the best meal we had in Vegas apart from the Bellagio Buffet. If we went to Vegas again, we'd probably stay somewhere closer to the Strip, with less rooms and bigger pools!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: DXJCSU
Reviews.Content: We book the resort for 1 week through RCI exchange program. The first impression when we walk into the reception area was WOW~ It is not as luxury as Bellagio or Venetian, but it is certain a comfortable space for people who come it to relax from 35C of outside sun. We were assigned to 14th floor in building 2 which is the main building. It was another wow when we walk into our condo-like room and look out of the window and see the beautiful swimming pool. Everything in the condo was clean and ready to go. All the utensils and glassware were available. We had enough towels and request more soaps and shampoo with ease. Although they only provide 2 bags of laundry detergent, we had no problem getting through the week. We enjoy the pool every afternoon since day 1. My wife and I enjoy afternoon nap beside pool.
